description: Aged 20 months in French and American oak (40% new), it has light aromas of high toned dried herbs, black currant and olive. It's airy in feel with the tannins providing some gruffness to an otherwise soft, silky wine.
title: Alder Ridge 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: A twist of clove, fig and chocolate figure into this powerful, concentrated wine, with baked plum, tobacco and maple taking on secondary roles. It's full bodied and thick, so pair appropriately. It finishes in black pepper.
title: Rock Wall 2012 Westphall Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

description: Sharp, dense, tight and oaky; this has a lot of plump pineapple, apple and sweet citrus fruit. There is a wonderful mix of spice, herb, fruit and acid. Deep and focused, this wine has serious guts and the flavors last a good long time.
title: Januik 2006 Elerding Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Smelling of coconut on the nose, this Malbec is good, like a big mouthful of cherry pie.
title: Chacewater 2009 Malbec (Red Hills Lake County)

description: Soft, simple and sweet, this easy-drinking wine has ripe, forward flavors of Lifesaver candies, wildflowers, spices and honey.
title: Holly's Hill 2006 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

description: This has a light yellow color with a touch of green and a subtle smell of crisp green apples. Flavors that are richer than expected, like poached pears, butter and fig. The texture is rich, the body full and the ripe flavors linger on the finish.
title: Occasio 2013 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: A dark, rich, ripe Syrah that defines the California style, and preserves the fine structure that this cool-climate region lends to red wines. The wine is dry and tannic, and the flavors, of blackberries, cherries, blueberries, dark chocolate and sweet, smoky oak, are just delicious. Now and for a few years.
title: Hahn 2007 SLH Estate Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is dry and rich in blackberry jam flavors. Right now it's fierce in tannins and acidity, making it tough and resistant in feeling. Give it several hours in a decanter before serving, or else hold it for 4-5 years.
title: Antica 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Just 6% Viognier makes all the difference in this Syrah-based blush. It adds a crisp, cutting edge of acidity and a lemony, wildflower brightness to the cherries and red currants the Syrah brings. Then there are the roses, lavender, tangerine zest and pepper that make this unoaked wine even more complex.
title: Sunstone 2006 Syrah Ros茅 (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: More than 75% of this wine comes from Ciel du Cheval vineyard, with the rest from Upchurch. A blend of 67% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, it's reserved at present, with light aromas of woodspice, coffee, assorted dried herbs and mineral. The cherry and cassis flavors show a mixture of richness and restraint, persisting on the finish along with enough tannins to go the distance. It will be best 2022鈥?027.
title: DeLille 2012 Chaleur Estate Red (Red Mountain)

description: Spicy and herbal, with a palate reminiscent of Sauvignon Blanc, this blends a grassy aroma with a mix of citrus, apple and pear notes. It has excellent concentration through the midpalate, with a clean, fresh finish.
title: Waterbrook 2011 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this well-made white has lively acidity and a linear approach to flavor, focusing clearly on orange, apple and melon around a full-bodied palate. Pear and lime appear on the finish.
title: Mersenne 2015 Dalla Gasperina Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

description: This is a Cabernet with intense berry concentration and soft tannins. It's very dry and savory, with leathery black cherry and cassis bursting almost out of its seams, finishing with a hint of dark chocolate. Nicely crafted, this shouldn't overpower your food.
title: Topel 2006 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)

description: This block selection is from the vineyard's highest elevation vines. It shows extra cut and precision, with mineral flavors under tight raspberry fruit. Tannins are polished and proportionate, and the wine has a sculpted mouthfeel. It was fermented with native yeast, and aged 15 months in one-quarter new French oak.
title: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2014 Krista's Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This shows the sharper, more herbaceous side of the grape, though perhaps without being fully ripe. It seems to fall away quickly into simple lemon juice flavors, with a hint of herb.
title: Vin du Lac 2008 LEHM Sauvignon Blanc (Chelan County)

description: This wine is bold and brawny, defined by big, oaky tannin and concentrated weight. Fresh black cherry develops a candied quality in the glass, while an earthy undercurrent of minty forest adds complexity.
title: Acacia 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Darker notes of espresso and dried herbs contrast with fragrant blossom and cherry aromas on this plump, full-bodied wine. Supple like silk, it's rich and ripe with cherry and plum flavors blanketed soft, chalky tannin.
title: W枚lffer 2012 Merlot (Long Island)

description: The nose of this wine combines this grape's best attributes: bright, crisp citrus redolent in grapefruit and Key lime, but with a tropical touch of guava and pineapple. The palate is broad and ripe but restrained enough, with plush mango and guava laid against a chalky backbone.
title: Buttonwood 2015 Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Blended with 6% Marsanne, the aromas are light (considering the appellation and producer), bringing notes of herb, smoked meat, white pepper, mineral and earth. The flavors are tart and bright, creating a real sense of freshness and vibrancy.
designation: Estate The Contender In the Rocks Vineyard
title: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2014 Estate The Contender In the Rocks Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Deep black plum aromas are enhanced by soy and crushed graphite on the nose of this bottling. It lands on the palate softly, with tangy plum and turned loam flavors, its tannins sticky and persistent.
title: Bridlewood 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This is a young, yeasty wine with a scent of fresh citrus. Lemon and grapefruit are the main flavors, with a textural, refreshing mouthfeel and a hint of minerality.
title: Anne Amie 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: Round peach, ripe nectarine, melon and Anjou pear aromas shows on the nose of this bottling, tempered by a grassy and wet steel character. The palate shows poached apple and pear flavors, accented with lime.
title: South Coast 2016 Dry Gewurztraminer (Temecula Valley)

description: A little ungainly at first blush, with tannicly sharp elbows and some green, minty flavors. But it shows some pretty cherries and spices, and is dry and silky.
title: Olson Ogden 2006 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Despite its Washington-designated label, this blend of 45% Grenache, 40% Syrah and 15% Mourv猫dre all comes from Lonesome Springs Vineyard in the Yakima Valley. The aromas of coffee, cherry, red apple and peppery spices are generous, while the palate is full and creamy in feel, with the texture providing much of the appeal.
title: DaMa 2011 Damnation Lonesome Springs Vineyard Red (Washington)

description: Harmony and balance are the hallmarks of this full-bodied and vibrant wine in which everything seems well woven together. It smells like bright cherry, cinnamon and cloves, and tastes brisk and tangy like red cherries. A velvety texture complements the brightness of the fruit flavors.
title: Senses 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Winemaker Dave Potter heads to his old haunting grounds around Rancho Cucamonga to source fruit for this fun bottling, which shows wet soil and sour cherries on the nose. The palate is very down the middle and built to please, with flavors of cherry and baking spice.
title: Municipal Winemakers 2016 Debra Blush Wine Ros茅 (California)

description: Made in a style so ripe and direct in fruit and oak, it's almost simple, with spun sugar flavors of raspberries, cherries, anise and vanilla. Those flavors are delicious, yet the wine lacks structural integrity.
title: Sierra Madre 2006 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This blend of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc presents a very pretty nose of nectarine, yeast and chalk. The stone fruit flavors persist on the palate, kicked up by white flowers and lime juice.
title: Laetitia NV Brut Cuvee Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This blend of Petit Verdot (65%) and Cabernet Sauvignon is an aromatic brooder, with notes of lemon peel, flowers and cherry. Bright acidity livens up the palate, which is full of cherry flavors and well-integrated tannins. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
title: Styring 2012 Reckless Red (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Soft and fruity, with jammy flavors of cherries and currants edged with peppery spices. A nice, simple table wine based on Syrah and Barbera.
title: Hey Mambo 2007 Sultry Red Red (California)

description: Exhibiting cooler-climate characteristics, the fruit sourced primarily from the Stag's Leap District, this wine shows dried herb and cedar on the nose, evolving deeper layers of red cherry and cranberry on the midpalate. It takes on weight and structure on the finish.
title: Judd's Hill 2010 Founder's Art Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This has bright raspberry and almost-sweet blackberry flavors, full body, moderate tannins and a long warm finish. It tastes polished, soft and satiny smooth.
title: Cline 2012 Live Oak Vineyards Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

description: Blended with Merlot, Malbec and Cabernet Franc, this wine remains somewhat generic in tone and style, offering red berry and currant in measured doses around a big body and cut of oak.
title: Foley Johnson 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Friendly, appealing flavors fo pear, lychee, apple and spice give this Riesling a fun character. Fresh with a touch of sweetness, the wine is balanced by its acid and offers a pretty, lingering finish.
title: Debonn茅 2008 Reserve Riesling (Grand River Valley)

description: Aromas offer an assortment of high-toned black licorice, woodspice and dark-cherry notes. The rich black-fruit flavors reflect the warm vintage while staying in balance.
title: Full Pull & Friends 2013 Bacchus Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: True to the dense, muscular style of Woodward Canyon's Merlots, this elevates the complexity in a near-perfect vintage. Deep and textural, it packs together concentrated red fruits, preserves and cassis. At first it shows a little heat from the 15% alcohol, but as it breathes open over hours (and even days) the primary fruit gives way to subtle veins of olive, earth, coffee and toast.
title: Woodward Canyon 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Smooth and pleasantly herbal, this is a silky wine with a mix of blueberry, plum and cherry fruit. It spent 20 months in barrel, which lends a light chocolate note to the fruit. Velvety, delicate and most delightful, it should be consumed while it retains its youthful freshness.
title: Plaisance Ranch 2011 Merlot (Applegate Valley)

description: Fermented and matured in neutral oak barrels for seven months of lees aging, this has a scent reminiscent of slightly oxidized apple and pear slices, with supporting notes of blonde caramel, lemon yogurt and nectarine. Soft and lax on the attack, it gains vibrancy on the midpalate, ending with a pleasing lemon grass lift.
title: Barboursville Vineyards 2011 Reserve Vermentino (Virginia)

description: Too unripe to earn a higher score, this Cab shows stemmy, mint-green flavors that overwhelm the modest cherries and blackberries.
title: Arrow Creek 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Herbal and tight, with a whiff of burnt rubber in front of some tart fruit. There is some concentration, and with more bottle age the wine may yet flesh out a bit.
title: Basel Cellars 2008 Chelle den Millie Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Shows the thick, furry tannins Petite Sirah is known for, with some good black currant, anise and cedar flavors. Feels a bit sharp, with a cut of mint. Drink now.
title: J. Rickards 2007 Brown Barn Vineyard Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)

description: Epitomizes the New World style of a superripe, soft, plush wine, bursting with fruity-berry flavors, and generously oaked. Hard to imagine a wine flattering the palate more, with its graceful tannins and heaps of blackcurrant, sweet roasted pepper, olive and white chocolate flavors. Instantly appealing, although it may be a difficult match for food.
title: Shafer 2000 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The grapes for hail from both Carneros and Oak Knoll and have undergone both barrel and stainless steel fermentation. The result is a medium-weight to fuller-style of clean, crisp lemon and pear flavors, a swirl of tropical vanilla on the finish.
title: Educated Guess 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Decent, everyday Pinot, with good varietal character, if not especially complex. The wine is dry, silky and crisp, with modest cherry and cola flavors.
title: Mountain View 2007 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Expansive, long and tannic, this wine is robust and powerfully concentrated, the flavors a mixture of tart cranberry, raspberry and black tea.
title: Fritz 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Black plum, blackberries, lilac and vanilla show on the easy if simple nose of this bottling. There's a load of perfume-like purple flowers on the sip, where a curiously strong acidity also carries cola spice.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2015 Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a new offering for Columbia Crest's Grand Estates lineup. Fresh fruit flavors emphasize lemon, lime and pineapple, backed with moderate acidity. A nice spicy lift informs the finish. Light and lively.
title: Columbia Crest 2012 Grand Estates Unoaked Chardonnay (Washington)

description: Lots of ripe cherries, blackberries and dried herbs in this young, vigorous wine. Shows considerable power and authority, at the loss perhaps of some charm and elegance. Drink it over the next 6鈥? years.
title: Somerston 2007 Highflyer Centerline Red (Napa Valley)

description: Hot pink in color and showing some bricking, light aromas of cherry and spice are followed by broad-feeling fruit flavors that are a hair off dry. It comes off as a bit ponderous but there's enjoyment to be had.
title: Wine o'Clock 2014 Ros茅 (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This pure Merlot has the grip and muscle often found in Washington fruit; in fact, it's a bit tight at first. Notes of red plum, strawberry and stiff tannins carry the medium finish, with a nice hint of dried herb.
title: Thomas O'Neil Cellars 2009 Fahrenheit 100 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is well-made in a classic Oregon mold, which is to say, putting plenty of herbal highlights into the mix. There are light red fruits in abundance as well, and the flavors meld well through a medium-long finish.
title: Lange 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The best of the new releases from Michael Florentino, which has changed hands since this vintage was harvested. Autumnal flavors marry vivid, distinctive fruit to hints of leaf and citrus, elegant and complex.
title: Michael Florentino 2008 Monastrell AKA Mourv猫dre Mourv猫dre (Yakima Valley)

description: Very deep color, potent aromas and a dense, but velvety texture paint a bold picture for this full-bodied wine. It has the drama and flavor recalling an expensive red, without overpowering tannins or a high price.
title: Bota Box 2013 Nighthawk Black Red (California)

description: Aromas of dried cranberry, raspberry, vanilla, dill and spice are followed by velvety fruit and barrel flavors that show a lovely sense of balance. It provides plenty of interest but the barrel notes seem a bit too predominant.
title: Dumas Station 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Black pepper, graphite and reluctant boysenberry notes balance the rubbery funk on the nose of this cool-climate Syrah. It's fairly light on the palate, with just-ripe boysenberry and chopped Italian herbs.
title: Manzoni 2012 Home Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Soft and rich, this Chardonnay shows intricately layered flavors of buttered toast, grilled peaches, orange jam, honeysuckle flowers and cinnamon. An opulent wine to drink now.
title: Laird 2008 Red Hen Ranch Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: This is the kind of wine you'll find sold at pizzerias, taco joints and Chinese restaurants everywhere. It's soft, simple and fruity, with cherry and cola flavors.
title: Cable Car NV Red (California)

description: Soft and ripe, it's easy to drink now. The cherry, blackberry and cassis flavors are full, with suggestions of raisins, but the finish is dry. Cabernet's tannins are there too, giving the wine an astringent bite that calls for rich, fatty meats and cheeses.
title: White Oak 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: There's a hint of a sweaty, earthy undertone in the nose, and this wine shows a fair amount of stem and earth flavors. Sour cherry fruit adds a lighter layer, with notes of cement and bark. It spent time in 11% new oak.
title: Day 2014 Crowley Station Vineyards Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Made using grapes grown high in the Mayacamas Mountains, this is extremely concentrated in pineapple essence, peach custard and tropical fruit flavors. It's extravagant, with 50% new French oak playing a strong role in contributing notes of buttered toast, cr猫me br没l茅e and butterscotch to the flavor profile.
title: Moone-Tsai 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Black as night in the glass, this wine鈥攚hich come from the Mann Vineyard鈥攊s evened out with 13% Merlot and spent 30 months in American oak. Brown spice, black cherries and oregano power the palate along with notes of dried cherries and tobacco. It's drinking quite nicely right now.
title: Equinox 2009 Bartolo Petit Verdot (Santa Clara Valley)

description: The aromas are vibrant, with notes of flowers, jasmine, lime and peach. The palate drinks a hair off dry, with the concentration coming off as light but still providing interest.
title: Columbia Winery 2014 Riesling (Ancient Lakes)

description: This blend of Chardonnay, Viognier and Marsanne from Rh么ne grape pioneer Bob Lindquist and partner Charles Banks is a new project focused on entry-level offerings. Steely aromas of lemon oil and pear give way to a plate of buttered apple slices and tart yellow-grapefruit peel, mixing warmth with tang.
title: Qup茅 2014 A Modern White (Central Coast)

description: Made in a full-bodied style with a density of firm tannins, this wine offers a mix of ripe black cherry and black licorice notes, the core succulent and strong.
title: Screen Door Cellars 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A strong streak of pure vanilla highlights the flavors here. The fruit tastes of fresh-picked strawberries. This is 100% Syrah made from estate-grown fruit.
title: Hyatt 2009 Syrah (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: Though it seems to have some of the lightness of young vines in the cherry fruit flavor, there is clear Red Mountain terroir in the mouthfeel. Tight, dark, supple and almost steely, this layers its fruit atop a mineral base, and finishes with a whiff of smoke and pickle barrel.
title: Market Vineyards 2009 Acquisition Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Fantastically ripe and oaky, a Chardonnay that just swamps the palate with wave after wave of pineapple jam, tangerine tart, apricot pie filling and sweet butterscotch and vanilla flavors. All this richness fortunately is balanced with crisp acidity and a fine tang of minerals.
title: Fess Parker 2010 Ashley's Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Bright, polished and fleshy pear flavors hold center court here, supported with a light sprinkling of peppery herb. Proportionate acids keep the wine crisp and clean through the finish.
title: Erath 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: This is for you, if you like your Zins in a sweet, soft style. It tastes like the filling from a black颅berry and cherry pie, dusted with exotic spices, like cinnamon and black pepper.
title: Twisted Sisters 2010 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (46%), Cabernet Franc (24%), Merlot (22%) and Malbec. Aromas of dark fruit and spice are followed by cherry and black-fruit flavors, backed by lightly grainy tannins.
title: Patterson 2013 BDX Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Deep gold in color, this wine opens with a whiff of caramelized apple, mango and pineapple, following through with a richness of those flavors. Robust with a backdrop of chiseled minerality, it's brawny, full-bodied and brisk.
title: Raymond 2014 Generations Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Blended with 8% Petite Sirah and then aged almost a year in American oak, 30% of it new, this is fruity and smoky in equal measure. Its tones of blackberry, leather and black pepper are harmonious. Round and soft, it's easy to drink and will be approachable to a variety of palates.
title: Pedroncelli 2012 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: The winery's high-end cuv茅e, this is a five-barrel blend, three of the barrels new. Dancing in cardamom and dark cherry, the background ripe and toasty, the flavors are exotic and long lingering. There's a tension and intensity to this wine that bests speaks to aging, or a full decant; either way, it'll be delicious.
title: Lynmar 2012 Five Sisters Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Firm in texture and moderately tannic, this wine is poised for pairing with something rich like braised or roasted beef. Cranberry and black cherry aromas meet baking spice nuances on the palate.
title: Girasole 2015 Hybrid Red (Mendocino)

description: Still quite young and showing some grapey fruit flavors, this second vintage release is bursting with purple fruit and chocolate malt flavors. Streaks of cola and a mineral-drenched finish add depth and texture.
title: Drouhin Oregon Roserock 2015 Z茅phirine Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This dry, almost austere wine has some tasty but subtle characteristics including a toasty, slightly earthy and buttery aroma followed by subtle almond and apricot flavors. It will make a great choice with tapas or fish, and a nice change of pace anytime.
title: Vie Winery 2013 Roussanne (Lake County)

description: Possesses deep flavors of currants and blackberries, and yet you still have to wonder why it merits bottling on its own. It's bone-dry and tannic, and its austerity is a challenge. 鈥擲.H.
title: Iron Horse 1999 T-bar-T Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

description: A very nice Chardonnay for fans of the ripe, oaky style, at a great price. It's rich in pineapple, cream and vanilla flavors, with zesty acidity and a honeyed finish.
title: Line 39 2009 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Nice and peppery, with deep, impressive blackberry and plum, bacon and sandalwood flavors. It's a full-bodied wine with lots of power and elegance. Drink now.
title: Q 2010 Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: This beauty is rich in raspberry and blackberry leaf aromas on the nose, which carry through to the palate and are joined by flavors of kirsch, clove, lavender and tobacco. Well integrated tannins and bright acidity lead to a long, smoky finish.
title: Fabbioli Cellars 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

description: From the Napa side of Carneros, this beautiful wine begins with very forward aromas of cola, black raspberry, black cherry, tomato, mushroom, earth, vanilla, spice and smoky oak. Very fruity and lush in the mouth, with soft tannins. It鈥檚 rich and opulent, offering wave after wave of different sensations that are endlessly fascinating. The finish is fruity and long. Fabulous wine; enjoy it now, or age it.
title: Acacia 1997 Lee Vyd Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: What a fine Chardonnay. Made in a bone dry, minerally style, it may not have the immediately seductive quality of some Chards, but it does show a Chablis-like elegance that makes it a natural for food pairing, with its fine citrus and steel tang and mouthwatering acidity.
title: Foxen 2007 Bien Nacido Vineyard Block UU Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Light and delicate, this wine also offers a lushness to the texture, finding a balance between the two spectrums. Cranberry and strawberry dot a landscape of earthy tobacco and cola-laced oak, finishing with a bold taste of dark chocolate.
title: MacRostie 2014 Goldrock Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Is this a table or a dessert wine? Either way, the orange and apricot flavors are watery.
title: Kitchen Sink NV Moscato (California)

description: This well-structured wine offers flavors of preserved lemon and grilled pineapple, while floral nuttiness and a cheese-like impression give it a hint of funk. It shows some barrel reduction, which blows off as it opens up.
title: Grgich Hills 2014 Miljenko's Selection Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lean, dry and minerally, with tart flavors of grapefruit, lemon peel and Asian pear. The acidity is refreshingly crisp. This is a bottling that rarely does well in blind tastings because it's so austere. But it is elegant.
title: Mayacamas 2010 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Crisp golden apple and pear meet toasted oak in both aroma and flavor in this simply structured, light-bodied white. While it remains crisp and mineral-driven on the midpalate, it lacks complexity on the finish, getting to its point succinctly.
title: Acacia 2014 Winery Lake Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Self-described as a 鈥渘otable every day wine鈥?this meets the challenge. Given the price, it's a winner, with 58% of the grapes coming from the Umpqua Valley AVA. The light strawberry fruit carries herbal and bitter green flavors, yet everything is in proper proportion.
title: Underwood 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Docile aromas of apricot and peach linger under an oaky blanket of toasted coconut praline. Full and silky on the palate, the fruit tones remain quiet, taking on a lightly br没l茅ed character. Texture wins over flavor intensity in this Viognier that has seen 18 months in French oak.
designation: Single Barrel Thomas Vineyard Domaine Barrien
title: Nathaniel Rose 2013 Single Barrel Thomas Vineyard Domaine Barrien Viognier (Lake Michigan Shore)

description: A majority of Grenache and tiny bit of Mourv猫dre from Kick Ranch and McGah Vineyard were racked to concrete egg for fermentation, with the intent of preserving freshness. Successful in that quest, this orange-pink wine is dry, tangy and well-integrated in terms of acidity, subtle in cranberry, dried cherry and orange, with a light, refreshing finish.
title: Kale 2015 Ros茅 (Sonoma County)

description: Dark gold in color, this is a viscous, ripe and creamy white, layered in minerality and fresh-cut stone fruit. From a mighty mountainous vineyard, it offers bold, full-bodied flavor and texture, a testament to its site, and finishes big in juicy Golden Delicious apple and pear.
title: Krupp Brothers 2013 Stagecoach Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Though it seems quite light on first impression, that is a bit deceptive. The biodynamic grapes show a muted earthiness, while over time the cranberry and raspberry flavors gain focus and concentration in the mouth. A graceful, nicely proportioned wine, with some stem and grip to the tannins.
title: Kelley Fox 2007 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Asphalt, wet dirt, blueberry fruit and grapeseed aromas show on the nose of this dark and dense bottling. The palate starts with milk-chocolate shavings followed by tart red-cherry fruit. The acidity is overwhelming, singeing the tongue, and the tannins are a bit chunky. It should improve with cellar time.
title: Graveyard 2013 Dark Phantom Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: A perfectly fine, full-bodied red wine. Dry and tannic, it has ripe cherry and some overripe raisin and prune notes, wrapped into fancy tannins. Drink now.
title: Monticello Vineyards 2006 Estate Grown Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

description: This is rich and dry in blackberries, licorice, bacon, sweet oak and peppery spices. It shows lots of acidity and tannins, giving it a firm structure. Give it a brief decant and drink now.
title: Lawer 2009 Three Coins Betsy's Vineyard Syrah (Knights Valley)

description: There is a great deal of restraint exercised in this bottling from this warmer SoCal region, with tightly wound blackberry, black currant and turned loam on the nose. The flavors are also still wrapped up firmly, with more black currant, asphalt and gravel hidden behind sticky tannins. This wine is still young and should age well.
title: Falkner 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

description: Pineapple rind, lemon pith and orange blossom start off the aromas. The palate is a bit more opulent, with notes of honey-drizzled guava and mango giving way to a slightly astringent, semidry finish.
title: St. Julian 2013 Reserve Late Harvest Riesling (Lake Michigan Shore)

description: The Stoller bottling from Chehalem shows some dark, musky flavors, with black cherry fruit wrapped around whiffs of smoke and the commonly found Oregon notes of tomato leaf and bud. Despite its immediate impact, it falls a bit light in the back end, and does not have quite enough weight to support the thick tannins.
title: Chehalem 2005 Stoller Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Savory pepper, tangy blueberry, black raspberry and pencil-shaving notes show on the nose of this blend of 78% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Cabernet Franc, 6% Petit Verdot and 4% Merlot. The cedar and graphite element carry to the palate, where tobacco, grapy fruits and dill make for an intriguing sip.
title: Silver Mountain 2010 Alloy Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The winery is better known for Pinot Noir, but now turns to Chardonnay, with good results. The little-known appellation is in the middle of the warm-cool Sonoma spectrum, and the wine shows ripe orange, pear and pineapple flavors, brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2010 Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: Reserve is rarely a word found in front of ros茅, but here it seems meaningful. The 82% Merlot and 18% Grenache complement each other nicely. Cherry-pie tartness with a bit of sweet blueberry flavor make for a full-bodied, round and bone dry ros茅 that's substantial and delicious.
title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2011 Reserve Ros茅

description: Brooding blackberry, dark plum, dried herb, vanilla and bacon fat aromas are followed by sappy, rich, saturated fruit flavors in this wine. It's a hedonistic rendition of Syrah that holds nothing back.
title: JM Cellars 2014 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Deep black plum, clove, dried blueberry, dried roses and dried violets show on the very nice nose of this bottling by Bruce McGuire and pioneer Pierre Lafond. It's well structured on the sip, disclosing plums, sweet berries and touches of nutmeg and allspice. It's a strong showing for one of their more affordable bottlings.
title: Lafond 2014 SRH Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This oak bomb of a wine smells like charred wood, wood smoke and black pepper. It tastes much the same, with a lingering charred finish. Medium to full bodied, it holds only a modest core of fruit.
title: Replica 2014 Just Right Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Vanilla and cream, cocoa, and herbs really jazz up the medium-berry nose. Dark sweet fruit in the mouth, with some earth and cedar for substance. Bitter chocolate and espresso add backbone to the medium-length finish. Good and balanced, and not bad for current consumption.
title: Chimney Rock 1997 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: An incredibly concentrated, silky blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Syrah. Nothing shy about this wine, inspired as it is by the great Chateauneuf-du-Papes and yet undoubtedly Californian. Make that mountain Californian. With baked cherry fruit and baking spices throughout and serious grip and weight, this is one heady and delicious wine.
title: Prospect 772 2009 The Brat Red (Calaveras County)

description: Spicy and fruity, rich and full bodied, this has blackberry, cherry, currant, licorice and cedar flavors. Let it breathe for a while to allow the tannins to soften.
title: Elements 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: There's no oak in this Sauvignon Blanc. It's bone dry and shows crisp acidity. The citrus and gooseberry flavors are green with whiffs of ammonia.
title: Star Lane Vineyard 2012 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: The nose is a tad reductive at this point this wine's life, so it will probably only improve in the year to come. But it's exciting now as well, with candied lemon and dewy oregano on the nose leading into a racy palate full of sizzling acidity and grippy texture that clings to the mouth. A candied apple component flashes at the finish.
title: Brander 2015 Buttonwood Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc

description: Floral streaks of orange blossom open this wine, followed by vibrant bursts of lemon. Estate grown, produced and bottled, this fresh, balanced wine picks up weight on the finish, ending with a ripeness of voluptuous apple and oak.
title: V. Sattui 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A very light and flowery nose starts the package rolling, followed by light candied raspberry on the palate. Features a smooth texture throughout, with the slightest notes of cherry cough drops and fruit punch. A simple, straightforward wine that goes down easy.
title: Hauer of the Dauen 1998 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This classic blend of Bordeaux grape varieties maintains a classic feel throughout. It's elegant in frame, medium bodied and invigorating in acidity, yet rich with blackberry and cassis flavors. Tannins are bold and dense, but ripe, suggesting improvement with age. Hold till 2019.
title: Belhurst 2013 Manitou 5 Grape Blend Red (New York)

description: This Merlot is thin and common, but dry and drinkable, with cherry, cola and oak flavors. Gulp it down with anything you like.
title: Eye Candy 2012 Merlot (California)

description: Simple, sweet and sour, with apricot and orange marmalade flavors. A blend of Merlot, Carignan, Syrah, Cab and Petite Sirah.
title: Spann Vineyards NV Betsy's Backacher Red (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is tart with dill and cedar notes, sharp acidity showing through its concentrated power and generous oak.
title: Kenwood 2013 Six Ridges Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Yeasty at first, this Lodi Zin from Napa's Cosentino Winery is dense and on the clove and ultraripe blackberry side of the Zin spectrum, decently simple in its intensity.
title: M. Cosentino 2008 The Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: This is made in a ripe, high-alcohol style, which gives it a little burning sensation, like Cognac. The flavors certainly are delicious, exploding with blackberries, blueberries, dark chocolate and roasted oak. The tannin-acid structure is intricate and smooth.
title: a-non-ah-mus 2009 Alisos Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Comes close to a Germanic style, with tight, lean citrusy aromas and flavors balanced by green apples and pears. It's light and refreshing, never heavy or ponderous. Finishes long and tart, full of fresh limes, with just a pinch of sugar for balance.
title: Red Newt Cellars 2002 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Made from Pinot Noir, this is a dry, crisp young blush wine of some real interest and complexity. It has flavors of unsweetened orange pekoe tea, tangerine zest and vanilla, with a scour of dusty tannins.
title: Perbacco Cellars 2006 Chiaretto Ros茅 (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: The pear and almond-butter aromas are quite light. The palate reveals more, with an elegant, textured feel and a finish that lingers.
title: Charles & Charles 2014 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Gavin Chanin has managed to make an Old World-styled wine with this bottling. More delicate than its boisterous Central Coast neighbors, it has an elegance that will appeal to Burgundy nuts. Pepper, pomegranate, cranberry and olive aromas lead into an extremely light palate of candied raspberry, red plum and uncrushed peppercorn flavors.
title: Chanin 2015 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: A little one-dimensional in apricot and citrus flavors, but pretty good for an everyday white wine. It's brisk in acidity, making it a good partner to sweet, salty foods like ham and sausages.
title: Curveball NV Spinning White Lot #3 White (Sonoma County)

description: A bright, vivacious, juicy and fruit-driven style, loaded with boysenberries. Tart and racy, this has just a hint of a gamy undertone. The finish has smooth, silky tannins, and plenty of staying power.
title: Kerloo 2008 Les Collines Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This big-boy, 100% varietal Cab is reflective of both its vintage and provenance, a celebration of black pepper, blackberry and tar around an intensely full-bodied, bittersweet palate. Tobacco leaf and leather saddle interweave themselves through the wine's middle and end. Drink now through 2020.
title: D.R. Stephens 2012 Walther River Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: So ripe and high in alcohol, it veers in to raisins and prunes. It's dry and tannic, with the blackberry flavors veering into bacon. Give it an hour or two in the decanter, and drink up.
title: Cerro Prieto 2009 Paso Bordo Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This is a respectable effort; seems to be oxidizing quickly, but it is elegant and clear, with a tartness that is reminiscent of Counoise. Nicely aromatic, with the rose petal and light tobacco leaf scents of the Italian grape.
title: Chatter Creek 2005 Clifton Vineyard Nebbiolo (Wahluke Slope)

description: The fine vineyard expresses itself in the ripe flavors and textural balance of this Pinot Noir. It shows flavors of baked cherries, red currants and cola, with smoky pie crust notes from oak. A bit tight and aloof, so give it a good decant. Now鈥?012.
title: Sonnet 2007 Amber Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Meaty and dusty, this wine from a Vineburg-based site is full bodied, ripe and voluptuous with a light dusting of black pepper and clove. Within its cradling of dense concentration, an underbelly of acidity allows for freshness within the power.
title: Robert Biale 2014 Valsecchi Vineyard Zinfandel (Carneros)

description: With decent blackberry, cherry and oak flavors, this is an everyday Cabernet for drinking now. It's dry and tannic, and the finish is clean and spicy. The price makes it a good buy.
title: Bogle 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Canned lychee and lemongrass feels a bit thick and heavy on the nose. The palate follows suit and is medium in weight, yet lags a little in acidic verve.
title: Los Pinos Ranch 2014 Blanco Grande Estate Grown Blanc du Bois (Texas)

description: Damp sagebrush, dark cranberry, buttered black cherries, fresh plucked marjoram and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling. The tip of the sip shows great thyme, bay leaf and anise character, then settles into rich cranberry fruit, all held together by a decent tannic grip. The dark fruit flavors linger deep in the finish.
title: Chateau Lettau 2013 The Diva Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Vibrant aromas of honeysuckle, honey-drizzled peach and green apple lead to medium-sweet stone-fruit flavors. Pair it with a spicy Thai dish.
title: For a Song 2013 Caliche Lake Vineyard Riesling (Ancient Lakes)

description: The mighty Hirsch rises to the occasion of a burly, near-perfect vintage, showing off its ability to be brawny and brainy at the same time. Black fruit, tar and tea take center stage, with an intensely tannic underbelly specked in wild herb and smoke. This baby needs time. Drink now after decanting or cellar through 2023.
title: Williams Selyem 2013 Hirsch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Luxurious aromas of gingerbread, blackberry jam, black cherry juice and smoked pork meet with a touch of iodine, loam and lava rock in this wine from a producer just north of San  Diego. Red cherries and pomegranate juice tighten up around dried fennel stalks and pencil shavings on the sanguine palate. It's tasty now, but will blossom from 2019鈥?025.
title: Orfila 2013 Sequestered Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made from vines planted in 1965, David Hill's estate Riesling is aromatic and textural, with an interesting, nuanced character that brings apples, peaches, pears and passion fruit flavors in profusion. Despite 1.8% residual sugar, it has plenty of acid and alcohol, finishing with a creamy, lemony fade.
title: David Hill 2007 Estate Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a soft, easy wine, with sweet black raspberry, cherry and spice flavors. Drink now with a nice homemade cheeseburger.
title: Curtis 2009 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: There's an herbal undertow to this wine, with suggestions of dill and sage to the pineapples, green apples and buttercream. It's also soft, lacking the clean vibrancy that a rich Chardonnay requires. Drink now.
title: Frog's Leap 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This cuv茅e gets some extra time in 40% new wood, and is bottled unfiltered. Plush blackberry and black cherry fruit flavors, accented with streaks of cola and chocolate, capture your attention. It's a rich tasty forward immediately enjoyable bottle, so go for it now through 2020.
title: Omero 2014 Ribbon Ridge Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This very fairly priced wine from the fourth-generation winemaking family behind San Antonio Winery delivers aromas of black cherry-crusted charred meats with significant mint character. It's dense on the palate and quite tannic, but quite nice with blackberry paste, licorice and tanned leather flavors.
title: Maddalena 2010 Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: This is consistently one of Zaca Mesa's best Syrahs of several bottlings they produce every vintage. The mildly cool year was kind to the fruit, giving controlled blackberry and black currant flavors that are wrapped in refined tannins. The wine finishes with a swirl of smoke and peppery spice, plus a touch of warmth from the alcohol. Drink now鈥?015.
designation: Mesa Reserve Estate Grown and Bottled
title: Zaca Mesa 2009 Mesa Reserve Estate Grown and Bottled Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Tasty but ultimately simple, with raspberry and cherry jam, orange rind and plenty of sweet, toasty oak flavors. Drink up.
title: Rusack 2011 Ballard Canyon Estate Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Though definitely grassy in the nose, this round and juicy wine has compelling freshness. Flavors of grapefruit, lime, fresh herbs and a dash of wintergreen give complexity and length.
title: Kriselle 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

description: An elegant, lighter-style Pinot that oozes charm and finesse, from its vanilla-bean and cola aromas through the sweet root-vegetable and sour cherry flavors. Finishes well, with pretty herbal and fruit nuances that reverberate for a long time.
title: Brophy Clark 1998 Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Smoky bacon and a bittersweet element of black tea make for an exotically spicy, complex and full-bodied wine from the mighty vineyard site overlooking the Petaluma Gap. Black cherry, pomegranate and cardamom are wrapped in a swaddling of toasted oak, while the mouthfeel is dense and concentrated.
title: Black Kite 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Made in an understated classic style, this wine has a woody persistence of dried herb and mountain sage amid a grip of dusty tannin. Pencil shavings and red currant provide a yin and yang of structure and subtle character.
title: Buehler 2014 Papa's Knoll Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Integrated acidity and ripeness allow for a Good & Plenty licorice-like note, accenting the fresh apricot and white peach flavors in this lovely, easygoing sipper.
title: Sivas-Sonoma 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Estate grown and bottled, this affordable Pinot Noir brings light fruit flavors of watermelon and strawberry. Tannins are dry and the finish carries a hint of bourbon barrel.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2008 Cali's Cuv茅e Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Sweet and soft, this has pineapple, orange and vanilla flavors. The firm acidity helps to maintain some balance.
title: Dominican Oaks 2011 Unoaked Chardonnay (California)

description: A bottling commemorating the winery's 10th anniversary, this Merlot and Cabernet-dominant blend offers aromas of barrel spices, dried herbs and Red Vines. The red-fruit flavors are supple in feel with a reserved styling.
title: Pondera 2012 LTD Livin' The Dream Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: True to the Pride style, this Chardonnay is massively constructed, with an enormous blast of pineapple, orange and golden mango fruit, elaborated with sweet, smoky, caramelized oak. It's saved from being a mere fruit bomb by crisp acidity and a bracing minerality. Drink now for sheer hedonistic freshness.
title: Pride Mountain 2009 Vintner Select Cuv茅e Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A Lake County blend of 45% Syrah, 41% Cabernet Sauvignon and 14% Merlot that starts sour before turning into a mouthful of caramel molasses.
title: Beaver Creek 2008 Fairytale Red (Lake County)

description: Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon each make up 45% of this wine, with the balance Malbec. It comes off as quite green, with notes of bell pepper and green herb, along with unusual mesquite flavors. The alcohol pokes through on both the aromas and palate.
title: Cedar River Cellars 2014 Confluence Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine evokes black cherry pie cooling in a window sill. Kirsch, clove, anise and toast form a powerful bouquet that carries through to the palate. Fleshy tannins and a creaminess suggest a rich body and makes for a long finish that ends with a zing of tart cherry.
title: The Williamsburg Winery 2015 Reserve Merlot (Virginia)

description: A soft, fairly simple red wine. It has spicy, interesting flavors of berries, leather, tobacco and currants, and is nicely dry, with sturdy tannins that turn a bit coarse on the finish. Drink now.
title: Collier Falls 2006 Estate Primitivo (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This is a big, satisfying wine, smelling like ripe black cherry and cranberry, tasting concentrated like espresso and cranberry, and feeling like it's wrapped in a thick blanket of insistent tannins. It needs time to mellow or pairing with a protein-heavy dish. Best to drink after 2020.
title: Peace Water 2014 Passion Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: A pulsing core of dried plum and black-cherry flavors marks this buxom Petit Verdot. While bold and brawny, a balsamic edge and fine tannins lend subtlety. Its rich, mouth-filling silkiness clings pleasantly on the finish.
title: Sannino 2013 Spotlight Petit Verdot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Very rich in texture and lightly sweet in flavor, this wine smells citrusy and crisp but tastes full and soft. It has ripe pear and peach flavors and a lingering, honey-like finish.
title: Gregory Graham 2014 Wedge Block Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Coming from a vineyard near Solvang, this wine by Mikael Sigouin shows orange sponge cake, honey and the slightest twist of petrol on the nose. The palate boasts orange blossoms and bright acidity, gaining complexity from chalky white rocks and the slight bitterness of Japanese pear peels.
title: Kaena 2013 La Presa Vineyard Riesling (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Bedell's aromatic white blend bursts from the glass with exuberant scents of spring blossoms, freshly cut herbs and juicy pink-grapefruit notes. The palate is ripe and fruity, but balanced by an intensely chalky minerality and vivacious lime-juice acidity. Drink now.
title: Bedell 2010 Taste White White (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Lively aromas of brambly red fruit and spice are followed by plump raspberry flavors. It shows a lot of freshness and purity.
title: Angel Vine 2013 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of toast, char, and milk chocolate along with blue and black fruit are followed by velvety soft fruit flavors. It shows an appealing sense of balance and polish.
title: Columbia Crest 2014 H3 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Lemon meringue and graham cracker show first in this rewarding wine that's made in a lush, full-bodied, barrel-fermented style. Golden apple stands out amid the toasted oak, while crisp acidity shines on the finish.
title: Silverpoint Cellars 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Racy, zesty aromas of honey and squeezed orange form the nose of this still-tight wine, a blend of 62% Grenache Blanc and 38% Rousanne from a vineyard at the mouth of the Arroyo Seco appellation. The crisp palate offers pear and apple cider flavors with a finish of honeydew melon. A perfect pairing for halibut and shellfish.
title: Bonny Doon 2011 Le Cigare Blanc Beeswax Vineyard White (Arroyo Seco)

description: The Jim Clendenen project focuses on wines the winemaker makes to please his palate more so than the bottom line. This one discloses aromas of white flowers, honeysuckle, applewood and a slight nuttiness. The palate shows smoked apple, chalk and lime zest.
title: Clendenen 2012 Stallion Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A beautiful and compelling Sauvignon Blanc that gives the acidity and citrusy brightness you want in the variety, but contains extra layers of complexity. Offers waves of fresh green grass, Meyer lemon, sweet lime and mineral flavors that don't appear to have any oak. Brilliant with crab cakes, toasted sourdough bread with goat cheese, or on its own as a cocktail sipper.
title: Long Meadow Ranch 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

description: Like almost all of Reverie's Cabernets on release, this one needs time in the cellar. Tasted in fall 2011, it's tight and grapey, with blackberry jam flavors girded by a firm, stony minerality and sweet, but hard, tannins. Give it 6鈥? years.
title: Reverie 2009 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: This is the inaugural release of a tiny new project from winemaker James MacPhail and his wife, Kerry Forbes-MacPhail. Inspired by wines that 鈥渄ance on the tongue,鈥?it's a worthy debut, showcasing earthy, stemmy roses, herb, tar and tea, layered across a soft, juicy palate of baked orange marmalade and cardamom.
title: Tongue Dancer 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (52%), Syrah (24%), Merlot (19%) and Malbec, this appealing single-vineyard wine suggests vanilla, freshly ground coffee, dark fruit and spices. It's sweet and richly flavored, with a firm squeeze of tannins.
title: J & J 2012 4 Boys Les Collines Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This wine is made in a ripe forward style, with lightly volatile aromas of apple, plum and dark raspberries. It's full bodied and pulls no punches as generous red and black-fruit flavors with cocoa accents show some warmth on the finish.
title: Ryan Patrick 2013 Reserve Northridge Vineyard Grenache (Wahluke Slope)

description: Given four months in concrete egg, this is an exotically crisp and textured white, lean and high in acidity with plenty of mouthcoating body to find its balance. Lemon, grapefruit and tangerine are the highlights, finished in refreshing layers of white peach.
title: B Cellars 2014 Juliana Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Cline makes a lot of this wine and they do a good job with it. Soft and leathery in spicy baked plum and blackberry, this is a perfet wine to pair with a myriad of midweek meals and outdoor parties.
title: Cline 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Cottonwood Canyon specializes in Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, but they also have three acres of Syrah in their Santa Maria vineyard. The result in this bottling offers aromas blending red fruit with minty herbs, like a cherry cough drop. The wine is fairly lean on the mouth, representative of a cooler-climate expression of the grape, with oregano, sour cherry, cranberry and chalky minerality. The finish is reminiscent of cr猫me br没l茅e.
title: Cottonwood Canyon 2009 Patience Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Predominantly Merlot, this Bordeaux-style blend includes 16% Cabernet Sauvignon, 16% Cab Franc and 11% Malbec. Given extra bottle age prior to release, it's drinking quite nicely, with plum and black cherry fruit, a rich layer of mocha, and a firm finish with polished tannins and lemony acids.
title: Brian Carter Cellars 2010 Le Coursier Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Savory, smoky, sagey and floral, this wild and remarkable rendition of a Rh么ne-style blend is made from 50% Mourv猫dre plus Syrah, Grenache and Counoise. Aromas recall grilled herbs and stewed berries, while flavors bring out sour cherry, chocolate and beef broth. It's full in body, with a firm and tannic texture.
title: Lynch Wines 2014 Lucky Cash Red (Sierra Foothills)

description: The aromas smell disjointed, with notes of barrel spice, vanilla and maple syrup. The palate is quite sweet and ripe, with abundant baking-spice accents.
title: Coyote Canyon 2013 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Primitivo (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Cherry and oak notes are pleasant on this dry and softly tannic wine, but it's watery in style and lacking in concentration.
title: Buffalo Grove 2012 Merlot (California)

description: This is the most complex and detailed of the current single-vineyard Pinots from Rex Hill. English Breakfast tea, cherry liqueur, moist loam, dried leaf and highlights of cinnamon apple pie all contribute to a feminine, elegant, well-crafted wine.
title: Rex Hill 2008 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Everything about this Pinot screams quality. Although it will only improve with time, it's certainly enjoyable now for its raspberry, cherry, cola and oak flavors that will pair perfectly with a great steak. The Dijon clones that constitute the blend reacted perfectly to the cool vintage, yielding ripe fruit along with tart acidity and firm tannins. Drink 2017鈥?027.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2011 Dutton Ranch Freestone Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A welcome barnyard funk of sour cherry, wet leather and mulched shrubbery kicks off the nose on this wine from the likable Joey Gummere, once know for the Kenneth-Crawford wines. Fennel seed flavors and violet characters emerge on the very pretty palate, which has both tannins and mouth-washing acid on the finish.
title: Transcendence 2012 F Street Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Pretty good price for a Napa Syrah of this quality. It's a pleasantly fruity sipper, immediately appealing for its ripe, fresh blackberry, cherry and leather flavors. Has a level of dry elegance and tannic complexity that lifts it above the ordinary.
title: Big Ass 2005 Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: This is all Pommard clone, with a tart racy mix of cranberry and raspberry fruit. It's juicy and young, with sharp, precise edges. Tannins remain slightly bitter, but a couple more years in bottle should fix that.
title: Purple Hands 2015 Latchkey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Reserved on the nose, this bottling eventually shows dried plums, berries, lilac and tar aromas. Dried purple flowers show on the sip alongside blueberries, plums, leather and dried-meat flavors.
title: Rock & Vine 2014 Three Ranches Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: Ponzi is promoting a multi-clone winemaking approach they label 鈥淐lonal Massale.鈥?This single vineyard example co-ferments five Dijon and 22 heritage clones of Pinot Noir鈥攖he most extensive in the country, according to the winery. Dark and lengthy, it's a sexy, complex yet subtle wine, with blackberry and black cherry fruit, a touch of soy and ample Asian spices.
title: Ponzi 2014 Avellana Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Clove and sage combine with brisk raspberry and warmer strawberry fruit for a lively wine. Flavors of black cherry, gingerbread cake, eucalyptus and lingering black spice comprise the palate, which is booming with mouth-watering acidity and strong tannins. Drink 2018 onward.
title: Clos La Chance 2012 Erwin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Kind of unripe and thin, with tobacco, beet and herb flavors, although a touch of black cherry helps. The texture is smooth, but the finish is a little watery.
title: MacMurray Ranch 2001 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light and simplistic compared to other bottlings from the winery, this is still quite tasty, with aromas of lemon curd, sliced green apple and tangerine blossom. The palate shows stone fruit, vanilla cream and lemon wedges, with a decently grippy tension.
title: Tantara 2014 Tondre Grapefield Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Gentle on the front palate, this gorgeously rendered Cabernet Sauvignon, with smatterings of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, develops weight and body as it goes, while retaining classic restraint. Cherry and cassis counterpoise layers of toasty oak, cedar and silky tannins, finishing balanced.
title: Far Niente 2012 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: There's a savage appeal (what the French call sauvage) to this unabashedly rustic Cabernet Franc that was fermented entirely using wild yeasts. Initial notes of tomato leaf and green stem blow off to reveal aripe red fruit with a gorgeously floral character. Tart acidity and a concentrated red-cherry flavor are accented with graphite and black tea notes.
title: Anthony Nappa 2010 Bordo Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Zesty lime and crushed stones lend revitalizing tang to this squeaky-fresh Riesling. Off dry in style, it's chock full of sweet peach and tangerine flavors. Forward and fruity, it's appealing yet elegant.
title: Sheldrake Point 2013 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Shows blackberry and cherry flavors that taste candied, almost medicinal. Okay with burgers and pizza.
title: Jacuzzi 2006 Morine Ranch Primitivo (Lake County)

description: Smooth and creamy, with mineral-infused pineapple cr猫me br没l茅e, green apple butter and smoky oak flavors. Rich, if a little direct. Drink now.
title: Clos La Chance 2007 Liebeler Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Exotic yellow-spice notes meet with lean lime pith on the light and crisp nose of this old-vine expression from a historic winery. Meyer-lemon rind and juice show brightly on the palate, where grippy chalkiness complements rich lemon-curd flavors.
title: Chalone Vineyard 2014 Heritage Vines Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Chalone)

description: Hats off to Beaulieu for producing a Pinot Noir this good. The wine is dry, silky and crisp in acidity, with cherry, cola, spice and sandalwood flavors. With more than 100,000 cases released, this should be relatively easy to find.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2010 Coastal Estates Pinot Noir (California)

description: It's hard to imagine any Pinot Noir being richer or riper than this one, which is made from a blend of vineyards from throughout the county's cooler areas. It's explosive with jammy raspberries, cherries, boysenberries and pomegranates, along with plenty of new French oak for buttery, toasty complexities. It will hold for a year or three.
title: Patz & Hall 2012 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Fresh blackberries, wild mint, anise and dried purple flowers make for an appealing nose on this appellation blend from one of the region's pioneering and esteemed producers. There is a pleasantly thick yet lively weight to the palate, with flavors of licorice, coffee, violets, lavender extract, dark purple fruits and a hint of asphalt.
title: Leoness 2012 Syrah (Temecula Valley)

description: Very tight and shy aromas of lime zest, gray slate and white rocks show on the nose of this wine from the pioneering Niven Family and their winemaker Christian Roguenant. The palate shows some grassiness, Mexican lime and an interesting warmth on the back end, proving quite lean and sharp.
title: Baileyana 2013 Firepeak Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Acidity dominates this wine, giving it a tart, almost sour taste. Couple that with the sizable tannins, and you have an uncomfortable wine. Call it rustic, old world. The blackberry, currant, coffee and herb flavors are fine.
title: Easton 2007 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: This wine brings pleasingly pure notes of red fruit, bramble, black olive and earth. The flavors are full, lush and pure, backed by tart, cranberry-like acidity and a lengthy finish. It's a compelling example of the variety, showing very pretty nuances.
title: Block Wines 2014 Boushey Vineyard Golden Block Grenache (Yakima Valley)

description: A delightful wine made from this increasingly popular variety, and a great followup to the 2009. Bright acidity frames fresh flavors of oranges, white flowers especially gardenias, and cinnamon. The finish is rich in honey, but somehow manages to be totally dry.
title: Birichino 2010 Malvasia Bianca (Monterey)

description: This Oregon-based producer has sourced Petaluma Gap grapes to craft a light, clear and somewhat smoky and full-bodied expression of the variety. It's dense and rich in black cherry, currant and cola-vanilla.
title: Lachini 2013 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Ripe but rather light aromas of pear cider, honeydew melon and cherimoya make for an approachable, familiar nose on this appellation blend wine. Lots of soft nectarine and melon elements define the palate, with a pinch of sweet herbs, proving light, pleasant and playful.
title: Bargetto 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This popular Chardonnay gives you a generous burst of buttered nuts and toast, the flavors many consumers want in their Chardonnays. Not much going on in the fruit department鈥攋ust clean, tart green apples, with a sharp, acidic edge.
title: Columbia Crest 2009 H3 Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: From a valley-floor site, this blend of 70% Zinfandel and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon delights in a depth of blackberry and cedar, reflecting well on both varieties. Firm tannin and restrained oak provide room for a touch of gun smoke and pencil lead, with a lengthy finish.
title: Paraduxx 2012 Rector Creek Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)

description: A surprising  Pinot Noir from the Puget Sound AVA. Tart, tannic and lightly spicy, it presents itself as a rustic caf茅 red.
title: Mount Baker Vineyards 2005 Pinot Noir (Puget Sound)

description: Tannic and fruity, with the taste of an energy bar. The flavors suggest ripe blackberries, anise, almonds, honey, pepper and dark chocolate. Drink now.
title: Mendielle Vertu 2007 Proprietary Red Merlot (Mendocino County)

description: There's a vibrant purity to this wine with its aromas and flavors of boysenberry, green olive, wet gravel and smoked meat, with the Viognier blended in (8%) only adding to its perfume. It coats the palate with a plush but still light and lively texture backed by a zing of tart acidity.
title: Kerloo 2013 Upland Vineyard Syrah (Snipes Mountain)

description: An intriguing oak spiciness on both the nose and the palate makes this medium-bodied wine interesting without overpowering the focused and vivid raspberry and red cherry flavors. The wine's texture is lean, braced by fine-grained tannins that give support and balance. Best after 2018.
title: Clos du Bois 2013 Coro Mendocino Red (Mendocino)

description: Some green, veggie aromas and flavors compromise this Syrah. Otherwise, it's dry and smoothly tannic, with red currant, cola and pepper notes.
title: Buttonwood Farm 2010 Estate Grown Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is Marimar's unoaked Chardonnay from the estate vineyard. In keeping with past vintages, it's so rich and savory, you won't even notice the absence of barrel influence. The wine is rich and complex in tangerine, apricot, lime, lemon and vanilla flavors, brightened by exquisite acidity.
title: Marimar Estate 2012 Acero Don Miguel Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Bright, fresh and fruity, this is loaded with citrus鈥攅specially grapefruit鈥攇oodness. There are layers of pears and peaches, making this a big, fruity, mouth-filling wine.
title: Thurston Wolfe 2011 PGV White (Washington)

description: A blend of three-quarters Syrah along with 17% Mourv猫dre and 8% Cinsault, this wine brings aromas of vanilla, herb, coffee and cherry. The blackberry flavors are lush and full, showing precision, with oak notes speckled throughout.
title: Cadaretta 2013 Windthrow Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: In an effort to further differentiate the Foreshadow Merlot from the Foreshadow Cabernet, winemaker John Bookwalter has kept each out of the other's blend. This is a riveting, complex, supersized wine, with alcohol over 15% and plenty of intriguing barrel flavors. The black cherry-berry fruit is swathed in spice, chocolate, cedar and coffee, complex and well-crafted.
title: J. Bookwalter 2008 Foreshadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This bottling is extremely light in aroma and flavor (though both will increase with bottle age), so its texture is its strongest selling point. Faint peach skin, nectarine flesh, melon and citrus aromas lead into a perfectly grippy palate, where citrus peel and beeswax flavors crescendo into the finish.
title: Leo Steen Wines 2015 The Steen Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: With its keen acidity and mineral-dominated flavors, this currently tastes a bit austere. It also has a core of orange, apricot and mango flavors that are sweetened by oak. Don't drink it too cold, and allow it to breathe before consuming.
title: Keenan 2011 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: Cofermented with a splash of Viognier, this was aged in one-third new French oak. It's got a dose of the Syrah funk, with spice, a streak of wintergreen, and musky cherry fruit. It's interesting and nicely woven together, ready for near-term drinking.
title: Quady North 2013 Steelhead Run Vineyard Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: Charred wood, espresso and thyme aromas lead onto the medium-full palate, which is supported by sturdy tannins. This Syrah would pair well with a pulled-pork hoagie.
title: Anemoi 2012 Lips Syrah (Grand Valley)

description: Shows a real Burgundian-style earthiness, with rich humous, mushroom and gamy, leathery flavors, marbled with a deep well of spicy plum sauce. This earthy richness, with the distinct tannins, suggests ageability for this dry wine. Best after 2009.
designation: El Jabal铆 Vineyard - Mt. Eden Clone
title: Alma Rosa 2007 El Jabal铆 Vineyard - Mt. Eden Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Pressed apples meld with notes of hay and cheese rind on the nose. The mellow palate brings similar elements, brightened by a squirt of citrus on the finish.
title: Ingleside 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: This is immediately recognizable as a bottling from a cool-climate vineyard, with tons of cracked black pepper, asphalt and black fruit on the tense and intriguing nose. That pepper character follows through on the palate, mixing with crushed bay leaf, underripe elderberries and a touch of black currant, but fruit plays second to the spice and structure. Drink 2017鈥?022.
designation: Th茅r猫se Vineyards Lester Family Vineyard
title: Martin Ranch 2012 Th茅r猫se Vineyards Lester Family Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Cinnamon and spearmint elements give depth to the pinpoint, laser-sharp fruit notes of cherry blossom and strawberry on this bottling. Strong herbal flavors of thyme and marjoram and spices of green cardamom of peppercorn hit the palate right away, seasoning cranberry and pomegranate fruit, and finishing on a slate minerality.
title: Black Kite 2013 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Herb, baking spice and exotic spice aromas are followed by tart luscious cranberry and cherry flavors. It comes off as a bit oaky but it still brings a lot of appeal.
title: Vino La Monarcha 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Dry, acidic and a little earthy, this shows elegance and restraint. With a medium level of alcohol and subtle citrus and mineral flavors, this wine is ready to drink now with roasted chicken or grilled salmon.
title: Kokomo 2011 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sommeliers will love this Chardonnay for its lean, Chablis-like elegance. The lemon and passion fruit flavors stand alongside stony minerality and a leesy, sourdough bread tartness, while the brisk acidity makes the mouth water. Elegant rather than opulent, this gathers momentum as it warms in the glass.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2010 Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is the inaugural release from this winery, which dedicates itself to the production of Grenache. A blend of fruit from Alder Ridge and Upland vineyards, it brings aromas of red plum, herb and spice that are followed by elegant, mouthwatering red-fruit flavors. It shows the variety's more delicate side.
title: Ocelli 2012 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The producer travels to Stagecoach Vineyard on Atlas Peak to source 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 38% Syrah and 7% Malbec, making for a softly layered wine with plenty of structure. Crisp red currant and plum dance around savory specks of cedar and toasty oak.
title: Patland 2012 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)

description: Lots of fresh, fruity flavors of raspberries and cherries in this straightforward, dry wine. While it's pretty simple, it has good acidity and is a good example of Pinot Noir for this price.
title: 31st State 2011 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Rich, upfront raspberry and cherry pie, tart red currant and sweet sandalwood flavors mark this Pinot. It's not one to age, but shows plenty of Russian River Valley style and flash.
title: Joseph Jewell 2010 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Nicely behaved and well balanced, this gentle wine offers medium body, fresh plum flavors and a texture that's smooth and lightly tannic. The color is relatively deep and aromas are fruity, with a touch of earth.
title: Bogle 2014 Merlot (California)

description: Cedarville is loved for its Syrah and Grenache but it can expertly handle its estate Zinfandel too鈥攇rown at 2,500-foot elevation鈥擳his smoky, raspberry-wrapped, silky wine is full of big, round mountain tannins yet somehow manages to be light on its feet on the finish. Have it with sticky ribs.
title: Cedarville Vineyard 2009 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

description: Bennett Valley is a little appellation in Sonoma County and it's been known as a good source of nuanced Merlot since Matanzas Creek specialized in the variety. This new bottling recalls those glory days. It's a fine Merlot, dry and silky and elegant, with ripe flavors of black and red cherries, chocolate and herbs. Try as a softer, gentler version to Cabernet.
title: C Square 2007 Merlot (Bennett Valley)

description: The Cabernet in this blend is Cabernet Franc, making it a Right Bank Bordeaux-style blend, at an astonishingly low price. Tart berry fruit and some stiff tannins suggest that a bit more bottle age may help to soften it; there are already some pleasing suggestions of barrel toast that run through the aromas and on into the finish.
title: Columbia Crest 2011 Two Vines Merlot-Cabernet (Washington)

description: This is a blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 45% Merlot, and 5% undisclosed varieties. The alcohol is a refreshingly low 13.5%. The flavors are of black currants, cassis, softened cola and leather, with plenty of peppery spices. Should hold in the bottle for a few years, but fine to drink now, after a few hours of decanting to let it breathe.
title: Stein Family 2010 Arleyna Red (Napa Valley)

description: Aiming to highlight one Cab clone grown in the dusty soils of the appellation, this well-crafted wine remains tight in grippy tannins for the meantime. Just enough compelling notes of cedar, grenadine, red cherry and truffle hit the palate to suggest further aging. Drink from 2017鈥?027.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2012 Clone 4 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: The earthy and leafy aromas are akin to Chilean Merlot. The plum flavors are attractive but there's also an indistinct berry/tomato taste that lowers the bar. A smooth, round, carefree wine better geared to casual parties than contemplative sipping.
title: Corbett Canyon 1997 Reserve Merlot (North Coast)

description: This wine is 47% each Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, with the balance Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Aromas of dill, dried herb, cocoa and spice are followed by soft elegantly styled dark-fruit flavors that show plenty of hang time.
title: Colter's Creek 2014 Koos Koos Kia Red

description: A pliant, medium- to full-bodied wine, this deals ripe stone fruit and golden raisin flavors, plus toasty, oxidative tones.
title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2011 Blanc White (Shenandoah Valley)

description: Lightly spicy and displaying a brambly character, with fruit flavors of strawberry jelly, this high alcohol (over 15%) Zin includes some high-toned, volatile notes. It is trending toward an Amador County Zinfandel style, though it is not quite that hot or volatile. All in all, it's a good effort.
title: Zefina 2005 Zinfandel (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: A little raw in acidity, with some green olive notes, but the rustic nature works in favor of the wine, grounding its rich blackberry, currant and chocolate flavors with earthiness. Tasted in a flight of much more expensive wines, this Cab did very well.
title: Morro Bay 2007 Split Oak Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Smoky leather, concentrated red-cherry fruit and crushed-brick aromas show on the nose of this bottling. More cherries and cranberries appear on the palate, where rocky flavors and dark spices keep the sip lively against a fairly rigid structure, five years in.
title: August Ridge 2010 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

description: Dark and thick in the glass, this wine shows strong but not bitter tar notes on the nose plus charred beef in a blueberry glaze, wet campfire, bourbon barrel and vanilla. The structure is massive now, gooey with thick tannins and flavors of espresso bean and condensed purple flowers. Judicious acidity ensures strong cellaring potential. Drink 2018鈥?027.
title: Alta Colina 2012 Old 900 Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: There's lots of exotic Viognier character packed into this fruity, slightly sweet wine. It's powerful in peach and pineapple flavors that are so ripe, they taste like melted jelly, with a hit of alcohol.
title: Parkmon 2006 Marsha's Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

description: Simple and rustic but perfect for backyard grilling, this Zinfandel, Merlot and Carignane blend is robust, tannic and superripe in berry-cherry and spice flavors. Cries out for rich BBQ sauce.
title: Pellegrini 2005 Family Blend Red (Sonoma County)

description: Aromas of herbs, tar and plum lead to sweet, plush blue fruit flavors. It's not a particularly serious wine but brings plenty of appeal.
title: Boomtown 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Tastes raisiny, overripe and sweet in cherry jam flavor, with a harsh, peppery mouthfeel. Basically drinkable, but not going anywhere.
title: Verve 2006 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: All Pepper Bridge vineyard fruit鈥?2% Cabernet Sauvignon and 38% Syrah鈥攖his is right in line with the excellent 2006 Sayulita, which came from the Lefore Vineyard. Bright fruit, tart and tangy, gives a juicy, fresh quality to the mouthfeel. Lots of high-acid berry flavors, are accented by light chocolate and caramel notes from 20 months in second and third use French oak.
title: Balboa 2007 Sayulita Red Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Barrel fermented and aged for 14 months in French oak, this enters with a nutty, toasty flavor around lighter fruit. Jicama, apple and white peach combine in the midpalate, then thin out quickly, with some bite to the finish.
title: Sol茅na 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: This appellation blend from Bryan Babcock is flamboyant on the nose, showing lime blossom, honeysuckle, wet cement and peach aromas. There's a great sizzle of acidity and pithy grip to the palate, supporting its strong stone fruit flavors.
title: Babcock 2015 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Juicy black cherry, tar and leather notes provide flavor and heft in this supple wine with sizable yet well-behaved tannins. Its firm structure balances the full body, as clove and just-roasted coffee highlights linger on the finish.
title: Flora Springs 2014 Rutherford Hillside Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: A great year for this wine, it's lush, satiny, spicy and ripe. Loaded with luscious fruit flavors of cherries and plums, dressed up in cocoa and cinnamon highlights. Hints of violets, licorice and coffee elevate the finish and the aromatics. A sensual delight.
title: Saviah 2008 Une Vall茅e Red Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Always a strength in the winery's white wine lineup, this is sourced from both Columbia Valley and Rogue Valley vineyards. It's aged entirely in stainless steel and walks a tight rope between citrus zest and honeysuckle, botanical herb and leafy green flavors. It's all in perfect proportion, and absolutely delicious lightly chilled.
title: Penner-Ash 2016 Viognier (Oregon)

description: Light red berries, red plums and cinnamon greet the nose on this countywide blend from Brian Loring, whose tasting room is in Buellton on Highway 246. Brown spice powers the palate, with more cinnamon, star anise and cloves, making for a food-friendly wine.
title: Loring Wine Company 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This structured, generously full-bodied wine offers deep layers of black raspberry and cinnamon, with an additional length of subtle black pepper and leather. It builds strength toward the finish before finishing surprisingly light and balanced.
title: Kristodd 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: Initial wafts of cannabis-like herbs quickly emerge into lime pith, limestone, struck match and oyster shells, with white flowers and yeastiness showing as well.
