description: Tart, citrusy acidity backs up cranberry, pomegranate and spice flavors in this dry, silky young Pinot Noir. It's somewhat brusque right out of the bottle, so give it a brief decant before pouring.
title: Holman Ranch 2010 Hunter's Cuv茅e Pinot Noir (Carmel Valley)

description: This wine is simple in its silky smooth expression of blackberry, chocolate and sweet tobacco flavors, imparting full-bodied concentration and modest oak.
title: Charles Krug 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: 鈥淣o oak/No malo鈥?the label proclaims, as if to challenge you to like it anyway. What's not to like? Fresh, leesy notes cleanse the palate, and set up the palate for the mix of melon, blood orange and pineapple that defines the flavors. Without any oak or buttery malo, what persists is the vivid, supple acidity.
title: J. Christopher 2012 Cuv茅e Lunatique Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Sweet and oaky, this Chard tastes like a vanilla and caramel cream soda, with alcohol and a squirt of pineapple essence. Defines the superripe, opulent style, without much complexity.
title: Paoletti 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This soft, simple wine, with small touches of Malbec and Petit Verdot, delivers sizable tannin atop notable acidity. Tart red currant and cherry meet cedar and a taste of toffee, allowing for a pleasantness on the palate that's rich and ripe.
title: Olema 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: Rich and oaky, this wine gives plenty of flavor at reasonable price. It has an abundance of baking spice, butter and toasted-baguette flavors, full body and a pleasantly viscous texture.
title: Matchbook 2015 Estate Bottled Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: A blend of grapes from seven well-known vineyards, this Pinot is made in a widely appealing style. Delicately silky but crisp with acidity, it has flavors of raspberry and cherry jam, cola and mooshu plum sauce, along with some sweet new oak.
title: Schug 2011 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This easy-drinking Cabernet has flavors of blackberry jam and toast, wrapped into firm tannins. It won't improve with age, so drink up with a juicy burger.
title: Acronym 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Bold and brawny, the Palmer Merlot offers up convincing scents of mulberries and vanilla backed up by a palate that's both juicy and gripping. Cherry, fall leaves and plum pudding flavors characterize the medium finish. Drink now or hold a few years for finer tannins.
title: Palmer 2005 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Strawberries, red currants and root beer come out at first, with cherry soda bringing up the rear. This forward, fresh and fruity wine is drinking well right now, and should be consumed through 2019.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2013 Elton Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This pretty wine shows how well this variety thrives in Lodi. There's a mushu pork note, with peppery plum aromas and flavors that are delicious, and yet the wine is bone dry. Adequate acids and tannins make for balance. It may not be a complex wine but it's a thoroughly enjoyable one. Best Buy.
title: Peirano 1998 Shiraz (Lodi)

description: This variety can benefit from new oak while aging, and the spicy layer that envelopes this wine is assertive but very attractive. The aroma is like toasted baguette slices and black-cherry juice, while the flavors are rich, layered and lingering. It's an outstanding wine made in tiny quantities.
title: Dante Robere 2013 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

description: Soft and somewhat waxy in texture, this is a dry, muted Chardonnay. The flavors suggest sweet hay and light tree fruits, and the finish fades quickly.
title: Hedgeline 2011 Chardonnay (Washington)

description: From the acclaimed Champoux vineyard, this puts the purple fruit in a wrap of pretty baking spices. Barrel aging adds cocoa and coffee, while the acidity is sufficient to keep the wine from feeling too tannic. Another couple of years of bottle age鈥攐r brisk decanting鈥攕hould put it at its peak.
title: Sineann 2012 Champoux Vineyard Petit Verdot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A grippy Pinot Noir with a hint of menthol on the nose, this wine is otherwise delicately high in acidity with a burst of tart cherry that swirls between soft, round tannins and brambly blackberry on the finish.
title: Reata 2012 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Rich and overtly sweet in raspberry and cherry pie filling, with a chocolate-butterscotch taste like candy. A big, lusty, opulent style of wine to drink now with barbecue.
title: Grizzly Republic 2007 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: Lush and forward, this lovely wine is bursting with red and black-cherry fruit. It socks you (gently) in the nose and seduces you in the mouth, with streaks of cola and a dash of pepper. No need to wait on this wine, as it is already drinking like a dream.
title: Bethel Heights 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: One of the first 1999 Cabs on the market, this wine smells and tastes like the grapes were crushed yesterday. This is what middleweight Cabernet Sauvignon sans oak tastes like: all fresh blackberries and cherries, with undercurrants of espresso and sweet spice. A remarkably tasty wine that should be easy to find: There were 65,000 cases produced.
title: Bel Arbor 1999 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Dark strawberries, rose buds, black plums, sweet cedar, tangy herbs and oodles of dark fruit pour off the nose of this wine, which is leveled by 13% Syrah. Bursting acidity frames the palate alongside red currants, peppercorns, dill and black olive. It's slightly less dense in style than other Mourv猫dres.
title: Mooney Family 2013 Mourv猫dre (Paso Robles)

description: The winery notes that these are the oldest commercial Riesling vines in Oregon, planted in 1965. This has a succulent core of sweet apple-flavored fruit, quite rich and delicious. It dries out a little toward the back, but continues with excellent length and more of that crystal clear fresh red apple flavor. It's got enough textural interest to keep it from feeling one-dimensional.
title: David Hill 2006 Estate Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine shows grapey and plummy purple fruit notes lead to an earthy palate, with hints of stem and coffee. No new oak was used, but it spent 22 months in barrel prior to bottling.
title: Twill 2014 Steelhead Run Vineyard Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: Attractive and easy-drinking, this smells like pomegranate juice and vanilla, and tastes like raspberry jam but without the sweetness. Soft and soothing on the palate, it finishes with a dash of spicy-sweet oak flavor that lingers.
title: Straight Line 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Just delicious, showing the promise of the 2010 vintage. The wine is ripe and intense in red cherry, cranberry and spice flavors, with a rich jacket of smoky oak. Feels like pure silk, while notable alcohol provides a boost of warmth for a chilly evening.
title: Sequana 2010 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Biscuit, burnt toast, and a hint of rubber dominate the nose. The fruit is light and somewhat buried鈥攁 little melon, unripe peach and pineapple. Perhaps too much barrel exposure, or over-toasted barrels?
title: Gilbert Cellars 2008 Estate Chardonnay (Wahluke Slope)

description: Bone dry, wonderfully fresh and loaded with strawberry and watermelon flavors, hepped up with lightly peppery spice. In short, a perfect summer sipper, chilled and drunk with picnic foods, preferably outdoors.
title: Viento 2009 Chukar Ridge Vineyard Sangiovese Ros茅 (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: A Southern Rh么ne-influenced blend of 51% Grenache, 25% Syrah and 20% Mourv猫dre, with a splash each of Counoise and Cinsault. Slightly high-toned, bright cherry flavors, pencil lead, earth, asphalt and grippy tannins. This will need decanting in order to open it up from its tightly wound entrance.
title: Brian Carter Cellars 2007 Byzance Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The vineyard is in Coombsville, a cool part of the valley that recently received official recognition as an AVA. The wine, which was made from 100% Cabernet, is soft, sweet and oaky, showing simple blackberry, cherry and anise flavors.
title: Hesperian 2007 Harry's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Tasting mature and mellow, this deceptively full-bodied wine has sun-baked aromas, prune and dried-cherry flavors, and a smooth texture. It's lightly tart on the finish.
title: Fenestra 2012 Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

description: The immediate impression is of savory umami aromas pierced with pine needle and sage highlights. Red and black licorice, along with sweet cured meats, bring complexity to fruit flavors of berry, cherry and plum. Toss in Proven莽al spices, coffee grounds and the classic Cayuse earthiness that continues through a deep, firm, beautifully defined finish. Drink now through 2030.
title: Cayuse 2011 En Cerise Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: A Bordeaux blend with a little Syrah, this red wine is dry and rich in currant and cedar flavors. But it's a little sharp and green in tannins, with a tart mouthfeel. A good steak will help, but it's not really an ager, so drink up.
title: Crane Brothers 2006 Brodatious Crane Ranch Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)

description: A little tough and gritty in acids and some uneven, green minty tannins, but there's a lot of cherry and raspberry flavor, and the finish is silky and long. Earns an extra point for the depth of fruit. Drink now.
title: Martin Ray 2009 Reserve Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: Black pepper and acidity, compounded by a lack of richness, combine to make this wine scoury. It has flavors of sour cherry candy and tobacco.
title: Kitchen Sink NV Winemaker's Reserve Red (California)

description: A pliant, lively wine to pair with roasted chicken or grilled salmon, this bears a forward note of red cherry, plus touches of cassis, char, herb and vanilla that add dimension. It's light to medium bodied, with fine, dusty tannins and fresh acids.
title: Hume 2011 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

description: Sharp in acidity and jellied, with sweet black cherry, cola and oak flavors.
title: Ca' Momi 2009 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Three things characterize this 100% varietal wine. It's crisp with acidity, fruity with lemons, limes and tropical fruits, and honeyed on the finish. Easy to drink it with slightly sweet, salted, smoky pork dishes.
title: Beltane Ranch 2012 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

description: This wine is beautifully floral, with a honeyed touch of apple blossom on the nose. Stony mineral and sea breeze accents add to its complexity, as seductive, smooth layers of creme br没l茅e and preserved lemon flavor provide oomph and grace.
title: La Follette 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine is jam in a bottle. Floods the mouth with ripe, spicy flavors of raspberries, cherries and blackberries, wrapped into a light, silky texture.
title: Hook & Ladder 2006 Station Ten Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

description: Anyone who doesn't love this Pinot just doesn't understand California's approach. It's a fantastically delicious wine, completely satisfying in raspberry, cherry, persimmon, toast, spice and vanilla flavors, and balanced with bright, coastal acidity. Just beautiful, and it grows better as it warms in the glass. Probably not an ager, but wonderful now and through 2013.
title: Patz & Hall 2008 Burnside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Quite a good Chardonnay for the price. Shows classic flavors of pineapples, pears and apples, enriched with smoky oak and vanilla, and folded into a creamy texture. Good value, and easy to find, with 7,800 cases produced.
title: Guenoc 2007 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: This wine is a blend of Primitivo (46%), Petite Sirah (29%) and Zinfandel. Aromas of huckleberry, raspberry, herb and spice lead to sweet blue-fruit flavors that provide enjoyment.
title: Angel Vine 2013 The Hellion Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Smoky aromas and a bold apricot flavor give this dry and seemingly light-bodied wine a distinct personality. Fermented in small concrete egg-shaped vats, it's far from simple and fruity, and instead offers great acidity and a tangy, tempting, appetizing personality.
title: Prospect 772 2014 Stepping Stones Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

description: Pessagno's Chardonnays are always big and strong wines, as befits their growing conditions in the cool foothills of the coastal Monterey mountains. This is monumental in fruit, bursting at the seams with ripe apricots and tangerines, sweetened with honey, yet finishing dry. It's a wine to pair with elaborate fare.
title: Pessagno 2009 Intrinity Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Hints of char, smoke and green bramble accent tart black-fruit and vanilla-spice flavors in this Shiraz (with a splash of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon). The dense tannins are tacky on the palate, but zesty acidity and fresh flower and herb notes on the finish add elegance.
title: Suhru 2009 Shiraz (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Harsh in the mouth, with tart acids giving a bite to thin raspberry and tea flavors.
title: Chime 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Thin fruit flavors seem overtaken by the barrel flavors. The wine spent nine months in one third new French oak鈥攏ot excessive by any means, but the fruit just isn't up to it at the moment. More bottle age may bring up the light apple into more substantial focus.
title: Hyland 2014 Chardonnay (McMinnville)

description: This wine shows the hand of the winemaker in the buttered toast, vanilla, cr猫me brul茅e, honey and creamy lees that dominate the palate. The underlying fruit is a little thin, suggesting tangerines and papayas. The price-quality ratio is fair.
title: Flora Springs 2011 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Erath's fresh and lightly fruity Pinot Gris is a bit more substantial than this new Pinot Blanc. Soft and fruity, this is a simple wine which does not challenge the palate in any way. All stainless steel fermented, it is the quintessential quaffer.
title: Erath 2006 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: With a pinkish hue, this wine has a healthy 21% addition of S茅millon. This contributes thick creaminess to its texture, built around well-defined flavors of vanilla, papaya and pear.
title: Duckhorn 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Sandalwood and smoke kick off the nose on this deliciously complex bottling that also shows aromas of black-plum skin, crushed slate and light fennel on the nose. Tangy cranberry and pomegranate make for a fresh entry to the sip, and then come herbal touches of white sage, bay leaf and peppercorn.
title: Landmark 2014 Escolle Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a bold but well-balanced wine, with densely fruity aromas, and appealing flavors of pomegranate and blueberry. A layer of fine tannins adds a grippy mouthfeel, making it great with a roast chicken or grilled lamb chop.
title: Parducci 2013 Small Lot Blend Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)

description: Fiano is an Italian variety, rarely grown in California. In this case it has produced an interesting wine. It feels midway in weight between Pinot Grigio and Chardonnay. Unoaked with a medium-bodied mouthfeel, it's bright with citrus fruits, honey and a fleshiness that suggests pairing with veal scallopini or veal Marsala.
title: Nico 2012 Fiano (Russian River Valley)

description: Happily, each new vintage of B茅soleil is a bit larger than the previous year, so more people can taste what a joy this wine is. In 2008 it's 82% Grenache, 9% Syrah and 9% Mourv猫dre. As with all the Betz wines, it is intensely aromatic. The wine glass fairly explodes with scents of grape, plum, raspberry and cherry. In the mouth grace notes offer hints of leaf and fresh herb. Plush and irresistible.
title: Betz Family 2008 B茅soleil Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Hard to know whether to classify this as a table or a dessert wine. It's off-dry and very crisp, almost spritzy, in acidity, with simple lemon and pineapple flavors.
title: Fenestra 2008 White Riesling (Arroyo Seco)

description: Ample helpings of allspice, clove and orange peel add dimensions to the hearty cherry and hibiscus on the nose of this entry-level wine made by the Talley family. Rich red cherry, vanilla, cinnamon and clove show on the sip. While it's not very complex, it is quite tasty for a midweek sipper.
title: Bishop's Peak 2015 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: This Rh么ne blend offers dried red cherry, boysenberry and rose petals on the inviting nose. The Grenache is a powerful player, contributing a rosewater touch to the palate, alongside cranberry, caramel and a touch of cola.
title: Cass 2014 G-S-M (Paso Robles)

description: A great bargain in a Cabernet. Shows lots of soft, rich, likeable qualities, with blackberry, raisin and oak flavors, and a spicy finish. A superb house wine, although production was only 400 cases.
title: TWODOG 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: Really delicious, a sweet, spicy, fruity wine that's like biting into a raspberry, roasted almond, vanilla and cinnamon granola candy bar. That's no insult. The wine is dry and wonderfully rich in smooth tannins, and enormously complex. Worthy of very fine steak, lamb, tuna and salmon entrees.
title: Testarossa 2009 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A wealth of oak and tannin marks the entry of this wine, a blend of 62% Malbec with 30% Merlot, 6% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. It mellows on the midpalate, providing a more supple experience of baked plum, raspberry and coffee, finishing with a full-bodied flourish of vanillin toast.
title: Tyler Florence 2013 Blending Sessions Meritage (Sonoma County)

description: From the outer reaches of Annapolis, where the ocean likes to assert itself, this wine is cloudy and stemmy, with a lively, carbonic-like freshness. Roses and citrus play off each other in complex, complicated ways, allowing the firm, present tannins to relax. Black tea and anise complete the picture.
title: Davis Family 2014 Campbell Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Buoyant aromas of boysenberry juice, white pepper and a touch of rosemary show on the nose of this blend of 34% Merlot, 33% Tempranillo and 33% Syrah, whose name means 鈥渕y steps鈥?and is an homage to the parents of winemaker Edgar Torres. Sticky tannins frame a medium-weight body full of sage, bay leaf and peppercorn flavors, which decorate the elderberry fruit. This is still a very young wine.
title: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Mis Pasos Red (Paso Robles)

description: Sourced from what winemaker Don Corson calls 鈥渢he best of the best鈥? this five-grape blend is modeled after Chateau St. Jean's Cinq C茅pages. It shows a carefully sculpted frame, with rich, dark, smoky tannins chiseled into a tight foundation for the dark currant and black cherry fruit. Notes of pepper and spice add interest to the finish, which carries a hint of minerality.
title: Camaraderie 2004 Gr芒ce Red Red (Washington)

description: This presents the opulence that many Chardonnay fans enjoy. It bears flavors of caramel, orange, pineapple, tapioca, vanilla, honey and cinnamon, which are wrapped in a creamy texture.
title: River Road 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This dense, richly thick wine is full of black pepper and leather flavors that complement its bright layers of black currant, plum and dark cherry fruit. Full bodied and balanced, it offers further complexity as it unwinds in the glass.
title: Armida 2013 Stuhlmuller Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: An easy, lush Viognier, front-loaded with tropical fruit, lemon, ripe peach, vanilla bean, buttered toast and honeysuckle flavors. Drink up.
title: Oak Grove 2012 Reserve Viognier (California)

description: Zesty acidity shines a spotlight on fresh citrus and mineral tones in this blend of Riesling and Gew眉rztraminer. It's not deeply concentrated on the palate, but a kiss of white blossom lends elegance to the finish.
title: Wagner 2013 Fathom 107 White (Seneca Lake)

description: While the nose suggests a hint of pressed apple, the palate on this richly textured Chardonnay is bright with yellow plum and apple flavors touched with spice, smoke and cream. Revitalizing acidity freshens the midpalate, leaving the finish brisk and clean.
title: Bellangelo 2013 Chardonnay (Seneca Lake)

description: This wine is showy on the nose, with lilacs, lavender-laced cr猫me br没l茅e and dense dried-black-cherry aromas that prove inviting. It is elegantly framed on the palate, with lots of lavender, potpourri, dried thyme and oregano set against the rich, dark-red fruits.
title: Justin 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Sourced from the best barrels made at the winery in 2013, this off-dry reserve checks in with roughly 30 g/L residual sugar, and plenty of acidity to more than balance it out. It's sweet, tart and sappy, with concentrated, juicy flavors of Meyer lemon, grapefruit and tangerine. It feels full-bodied and roundly fruity, then continues to extend itself with concentrated details of mineral and acid. A wine of exceptional power and length.
title: Trisaetum 2013 Estates Reserve Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: Subdued pineapple, lemon and orange blossom on the nose give way to similar notes on the palate, plus a slight guava note. Thin in feel, it does have a crispness that lasts through the tart finish.
title: New Kent 2015 Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: The nose is slighted lifted and high-toned. But the pleasing flavor of fresh raspberry takes over on the palate, and light touches of cocoa and sandalwood from 18 months in barrel bring a bit of depth to the finish.
title: Cherry Hill 2010 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: The nose and palate of this wine are quite mellow for the first few hours after opening but grow more compelling with time, so decanting is strongly recommended. Pepper, subtle blueberry, coffee and slate aromas lead into chocolate, black plum, charcoal and soy flavors on the palate.
title: Boekenoogen 2014 Bell Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)

description: Bright and brooding, this lightly-textured, medium-bodied wine offers smoke, leather, blackberry and baked plum. There's an underlying richness akin to decadent cr脙篓me anglaise, with a finish of clove and coffee.
title: Swanson 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Oak stands out, making smoky caramel and butterscotch the dominant flavors in this Chardonnay. Below that are fruity flavors of pineapples, green apple jam and peach preserves, finished with awesome Asian spices. Just 90 cases produced.
title: Kazmer & Blaise 2006 Boonfly's Hill Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The vintage was kind to this bottling, resulting in fabulously ripe flavors of cherry, black raspberry and cola that finish in a swirl of exotic spices. It's a bit heavy and direct in primary fruit, but the acids and tannins are fine, and should allow this wine to age for the next 6鈥? years.
title: Lynmar 2010 Quail Hill Vineyard Summit Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Pinot Gris has been making inroads in Washington of late and this producer has been leading the way. Pleasing aromas of apple and melon lead to dry full-feeling fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This unique blend is two-thirds Malbec and one-third Petit Verdot. Aromas of vanilla, baking spices, pepper, green herbs and dark fruit lead to full-feeling plum and raspberry flavors with a firm backing of tannins.
title: Bunnell 2010 Petit Bec BDX Northridge Vineyard Red (Wahluke Slope)

description: This substantial wine is full bodied, robust in flavor and firmly textured due to ample fine-grained tannins. The fruit flavors are tempting and ripe, while accents of black pepper and dried herbs add complexity.
title: Three Pines 2012 Tierra Roja Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: A first for Lauren Ashton, this barrel-fermented S茅millon was sourced from the excellent Dineen Vineyard. It's firm and tightly packed with melon, jicama, pineapple and green banana fruit. Highlights of honeysuckle and lemon verbena are also in the mix. The finish is a little short, but more bottle age might well bump up the score.
title: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2012 S茅millon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Lots of raspberry, cherry, vanilla and new oak richness in this Pinot Noir, and it's dry and silky. Would score higher except for intrusive acidity that cuts through the mouth like a scalpel. That makes it unbalanced, even though it's delicious.
title: Three Sticks 2008 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A good, somewhat rustic Merlot, with cherry liqueur, sweet tobacco and white pepper flavors. Drink this pleasant wine now with a nice roast chicken.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2008 Estate Merlot (Alexander Valley)

description: Blueberry, wet tobacco, charred beef, cedar and a touch of dried herbs show on the nose of this bottling. There is tons of acidity on the palate, where dense and dark purple fruits meet with cocoa dust, incense and woody spice, culiminating in a long finish.
title: Pear Valley 2013 Pear Valley Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Tre blends Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah from three vineyards in three different AVAs. Tasted just after being released, it showed good balance and flavors of cherries and spice, with some herbal threads running through the tannins.
title: JM Cellars 2011 Tre Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This would be a wonderful wine even if it cost a little more. As it is, it's a steal. Shows refined apricot, peach, lychee, mineral and floral flavors, finished with brisk, mouthwatering acidity, and an absolutely dry finish. One of the best Riesling values available in Cailfornia, and a tremendous cocktail wine. Just 600 cases were produced.
title: Brass Tacks 2008 Riesling (Monterey)

description: Bright, light oak shadings dress up this medium-bodied wine, complementing the red cherry and strawberry flavors. It's fresh, fruity and not very tannic鈥攅asy to drink and enjoy.
title: Belle Ambiance 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Thin but elegant, with a hint of truffle on the nose. It's stylish in a tart, understated style, with a modest raspberry flavor.
title: Longplay 2010 Lia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Black-cherry and plum aromas on the nose open to similar flavors, with toast and mineral accents on the palate. An elegant and refined wine, with a lengthy finish that displays cassis and earth flavors, and moderate, even tannins. Not a heavy or fat wine, it shows very good balance and should be cellared for three to five years.
title: Guenoc 1997 Reserve Beckstoffer IV Vineyar Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Light black cherry, turned black loam and dried rose petals show on the nose of this straightforward and earthy bottling. Black raspberry and dark cranberry fruit consume the tart, edgy palate, with shaved licorice, sagebrush and a touch of pine needle completing the savory picture. A good lesson in fresh Mourv猫dre.
title: Tablas Creek 2013 Mourv猫dre (Adelaida District)

description: This 100% Cabernet, from the iconic Klipsun vineyard, has been sourced from the original 1989 planting since the first crop, making Seven Hills Klipsun's longest standing customer. This offers deep cassis, mineral, and earth flavors, powerful and dense. The Seven Hills style, ordinarily restrained and elegant, suits this vineyard especially well, as it reins in the tendency of Klipsun fruit to go over the top, and become too tannic. This is muscular and deep, but proportionate and detailed.
title: Seven Hills 2007 Klipson Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: A good, richly flavored Cabernet that shows proper varietal character without any special qualities. Flavors of blackcurrants drink dry, wrapped in smooth tannins. May improve a bit with a few years in the cellar.
title: Imagery 1999 Sunny Slope Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: Rich Cushman made this wine; it nicely expresses the minerality and tight fruit that characterizes this excellent vineyard. This is at first a rather austere, compact wine, but it is dense with layers of flavor and representative of one of the most unique terroirs in the Pacific Northwest.
title: Phelps Creek 2007 Celilo Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Dark honey gold in color, this is reminiscent of cider. It's an interesting use of ripe Chardonnay, but finishes overly sour, almost bitter.
title: 3 Steves Winery NV Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Oakville specialist Far Niente turns to Rutherford for this single-vineyard, 100% Cab. The wine is soft and exceptionally ripe in blackberry and cherry fruit flavors, while lots of toasty oak adds vanilla accents that make the wine jammy. Doesn't have the structural complexity of the Oakville bottlings, but sure is tasty.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2005 C.C. Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Dry and tannic, this 100% Cab has flavors of herbs, blackberries and tea. It's a tough wine not showing generosity now. You can age for a couple years, but the tannins will outlast the fruit.
title: Rodney Strong 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Good and delicious, but so ripe, soft and oaky, whatever terroir that Spring Mountain contributed has largely been obscured. With lip-smacking black currant, chocolate and anise flavors, the wine is made in an anonymous international style.
title: Amicus by X Winery 2005 Special Blend Red (Spring Mountain District)

description: Fruity and simple, a m茅lange of thorn bush berry and tree fruit flavors encased in silky tannins and adequate acids. A good candidate for a tutorial on Pinot Noir.
title: Saintsbury 2001 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Very tart, almost sour, this high-acid wine just might be a good match for fresh oysters, but on its own it is slightly bitter and barely ripe.
title: Tyee Wine Cellars 2008 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: This new producer is off to a good start with its first vintage. The fruit is clean and complex, ranging from watermelon to wild strawberry to pie cherry as it washes across the palate. Deep in color, yet light in the mouth, this not only makes you reach for a second glass, it makes you wish the vineyard, planted in 2001, would hurry up and age.
title: Eastburn Vineyards 2006 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Dry in style and acidic, this blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier is marked by quince, papaya and Meyer lemon flavors. Despite its honeyed richness, it finishes clean and tart with citrusy acidity.
title: ONX 2012 Field Day White (Paso Robles)

description: This estate wine has 10% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon and is made in small quantities. Big-boned tannins surround puckering red fruit like currant and cassis before a brawny dusting of clove and black pepper hit on the finish.
title: Davis Estates 2012 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of browned apples and vanilla bean contrast with a steely backdrop on the nose of this wine. Seared pears, lemon juice and jasmine decorate the palate, which is relatively light in body, with a strong acidity and hints of fresh mint toward the finish.
title: Foley 2013 JA Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Vivid fruit flavors light up this extroverted Viognier, starting in the aroma and lasting through the long finish. It tastes like apricot, orange, pineapple, vanilla and cream. Good acidity keeps it lively and fresh, balancing the full body.
title: Cedar View Winery 2013 Reserve Viognier (California)

description: Very ripe, rich and new-oaky, with dazzling flavors of ripe pineapples, pears, limes, caramel and buttered toast, drizzled with vanilla honey. A crowd-pleasing Chardonnay of enormous power and concentration. Could use a touch more nuance and complexity, but a tremendous wine at a good price for the quality.
designation: Santa Barbara Historic Vineyards Collection Sierra Madre Vineyard
title: Au Bon Climat 2007 Santa Barbara Historic Vineyards Collection Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: There's a light whiff of the chicken coop here, adding an unexpected note of earthiness to the fresh raspberry fruit. The flavors spread out horizontally across the palate, coating it completely and lingering with a finishing touch of mint chocolate cookie.
title: Ken Wright 2014 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Complex aromatics link notes of pine needle, chocolate cherry bark and pepper. In the mouth it's smooth and supple, graceful and polished. It finishes slightly chalky and citrusy. Drink up by 2020.
title: The Four Graces 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A bit jagged, but fully dry, with some nice sour-cherry candy, herb and spice flavors. A good wine for parties.
title: Hill Wine Company 2009 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: From the heart of Oakville, this 100% varietal wine is luxurious, silky and velvety on the palate, a masterful study of texture. Lengthy and balanced, despite its powerful fruit, it suggests dark plum and cassis, with just a tiny note of cherry, the tannins refined and chalky. Cellar through 2022.
title: Amici 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: From a cool Forestville vineyard once devoted to apples, Appian Way is rich in Goldridge soils, providing a happy home to these grapes that offer a core of pomegranate and cranberry, laced in black tea. Light bodied without being wimpy, the wine is complex and velvety, finishing in nutmeg and ginger.
title: Joseph Jewell 2012 Appian Way Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Soft and direct. Tastes like a liquid granola bar, with melted flavors of raspberries, cocoa, roasted almonds, vanilla, cinnamon and brown sugar. Drink now.
title: Verve 2007 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Lamborn has a knack for Zinfandel grown on Howell Mountain. The 2011 is dry, tannic and high in alcohol, but also concentrated with flavors of currants, blackstrap molasses, licorice and cedar. It could benefit from some time in the bottle so hold until 2016.
title: Lamborn Family Vineyards 2011 The Pupil Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

description: This shows opulent blackberry and chocolate flavors that are delicious and heady. But it's very high in alcohol, which gives it a burn and a glycerine-like sweetness. It's a Bordeaux blend, with the addition of Syrah.
title: Chalk Hill 2009 Clara's Vineyard Red (Chalk Hill)

description: This medium-bodied wine is already drinking optimally, with a core of red fruit streaked with cola, earth, graphite and citrus notes. Only four barrels were produced.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2014 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The man who makes a million Syrahs dives into a blend of 60% Grenache, 25% Mourv猫dre and 15% Syrah on this bottling, which offers composting lilac, black pepper, fresh boysenberry, dried herb and a tarry quality on the nose. There's a strong blackberry-balsamic reduction flavor once sipped, as well as beef char, elderberry and more tar.
title: Andrew Murray 2013 Esperance Curtis Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is the inaugural release from this Oregon-based winery, with the fruit coming from Loess and Seven Hills vineyards. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (54%), Merlot (38%) and Petit Verdot, it offers laromas of pencil box, high-toned flowers, bittersweet chocolate, herbs and barrel spices. The flavors show depth and intensity as well as exquisite balance and length.
title: 18401 Cellars 2013 Proprietary Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Another of the single-vineyard Pinots from Brooks, this offers spicy cherry, chocolaty raisins, and dusty tannins. It penetrates and lingers, showing a lot of baking spices from its 18 months in French oak. There's a lick of sea salt caramel wrapping up the finish.
title: Brooks 2014 Crannell Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: There's ample varietal typicity here, with black and white pepper and meat notes on top of layers of green herbs, and licorice. Structurally, however, the wine has a few sharp elbows, with dry tannins and a disjointed oak note. All this is topped off by a pleasant, Fernet Branca-spiked finish. Drink now.
title: Chaddsford 2007 Syrah (Pennsylvania)

description: Very dry, tartly acidic and lemony, almost like a Sauvignon Blanc, but with richer notes of pineapple cream. Super-drinkable, and the low alcohol won't overpower a delicate dish, like sole in a garlicky butter sauce.
title: Lorena Garcia 2006 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Prominent oak and butter aromas and flavors give this medium-bodied wine a sweet impression, and its mouthfeel is smooth and soft. It smells like caramel and tastes like pears.
title: Muddy Boot 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: Broadley offers well-ripened, estate-grown Willamette Valley Pinot Noir at affordable prices. This juicy, concentrated cuv茅e brings a lively mix of boysenberry, blackberry and black cherry. It was aged for one year in one-year-old French oak. The focus, concentration and sheer pleasure cannot by overstated.
title: Broadley 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is rich and fruity and direct. It appeals for its acid-laced lime, kiwi, passionfruit and pineapple flavors and rich, smoky coat of oak.
title: Novy 2006 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a big Chardonnay that's oaky and ripe with fruit. Flavors of cream, lees, toast, Mandarin oranges, apricots and stewed peaches all mingle together in a spicy, complex and dry wine. Four additional years in the cellar will allow it to integrate beautifully.
title: Fort Ross 2011 Fort Ross Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Brisk and lean with a crisp red currant and plum profile, this dry, medium-bodied Cab is pleasantly structured with sturdy tannins and a fresh, herbal midpalate. A bit lacking in intensity and depth, and the finish fades out quickly, but on a sweet vanilla-kissed note.
title: Damiani 2008 Barrel Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: Predominantly Merlot, this Bordeaux-style blend includes 16% Cabernet Sauvignon, 16% Cab Franc and 11% Malbec. Given extra bottle age prior to release, it's drinking quite nicely, with plum and black cherry fruit, a rich layer of mocha, and a firm finish with polished tannins and lemony acids.
title: Brian Carter Cellars 2010 Le Coursier Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine's flinty, mineral aroma gives way to lively citrus flavors, great acidity and smooth texture that carry into the finish. It's subtle and medium bodied, with very good balance and enough complexity to hold interest.
title: Brutocao 2016 Feliz Vineyard Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

description: Half Cabernet Sauvignon from the Bacchus Vineyard, and one-quarter each Merlot and Cabernet Franc from the Weinbau Vineyard, this polished, dense blend reveals the complexity of old vines. A mix of perfectly ripened strawberry and raspberry is accented with a barrel flavor of coconut cream pie.
title: Tamarack Cellars 2008 Sagemoor Vineyards Reserve Red Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Soft, jammy dried plum and berry flavors fill this juicy, slightly tutti鈥揻rutti red. A semidry blend of three French-American hybrid grapes, Chambourcin, Marechal Foch and Vincent, it's easy drinking with just a whisper of tannins marking the finish.
title: Thousand Islands Winery NV Saint Lawrence Red (New York)

description: Veteran vintner Bill Smith delivers solid and often ageworthy Pinot Noirs. With this bottling, he's succeeded again. The well-known Marimar Estate Vineyard has given him superb fruit to work with, and the resulting wine is dry, full bodied and fairly tannic, with deep, brooding cherry, cola, white chocolate and anise flavors. While it's drinkable now, it should gain bottle notes after 2018.
title: W.H. Smith 2010 Marimar Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is Barlow's Bordeaux blend. Based on Cabernet Sauvignon, it's a beautiful wine, dry and balanced and fully ready to drink now, although it will take some years of cellaring. With fine acidity and tannins, it displays elegant flavors of currants and cassis, with rich edges of mocha and cedar.
title: Barlow 2005 Barrouge Red (Napa Valley)

description: There's not a whole lot going on in this basic Pinot Noir, but it does get the idea across of silkiness, dryness, tartness and light-hearted cherry and pomegranate fruit flavors.
title: Gnarly Head 2012 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is beautifully lilting in preciously defined aromas of rose petal and wild strawberry. From there, it's all subtlety and ethereal elegance. The wine is restrained, nurtured in a basket of nutmeg and graham cracker, as well as freshly packed mushroomy earth. This wine is a stunner right out of the glass, but is sure to continue its fine course through 2022鈥?025.
title: Williams Selyem 2012 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is overtly sweet, with a sugary edge to its vanilla and tangerine flavors. It has the clean quality you'd expect from a Barefoot sparkling wine, and will appeal broadly to the Moscato-loving crowd.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Moscato Spumante Moscato (California)

description: This full and smoothly soft wine blended with 10% Petite Sirah, 7% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot is aged in American oak, a quarter of it new. It pleases in bright red currant, cassis and wisps of blackberry, both approachable and sophisticated. Velvety black licorice meets smoky campfire on the finish.
title: Hess Collection 2014 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Saturated in every way, this sappy, spicy, almost surreal Tempranillo piles on the wild, gamy fruit, the mineral-infused base, the leaf and forest flavors, all around tart berry flavors. Amazingly deep color, fine-grained tannins, a sweetly herbal character, and great balance throughout.
title: Cayuse 2008 Impulsivo Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: The name references the mix of fermentation techniques鈥?0% neutral oak, 40% stainless steel and 20% new French barrels. Peach and papaya fruit are accented by a light streak of honey and a whiff of wet stone. This is both nuanced and beautifully proportioned.
title: DanCin 2015 M茅lange Chardonnay (Southern Oregon)

description: This 100% Cabernet shows its pedigree in the refinement of its tannins and dryness, despite lush blackberry and cherry, currant, plum and oak flavors. It's not really drinkable now because the tannins are so strong, locking the mouth down in puckery astringency. Will it age? The outcome is unclear, but the fruit doesn't seem intense enough to outlast the tannins.
title: Silverado 2010 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Earth and cola notes accent a true Burgundian nose of rustic raspberry and herbs. This is a stylish, reserved wine鈥攐ne that sits nicely on the palate and glides down smooth while still holding its cards tight to the vest. It should blossom and soften in about three or four years; now it has everything going for it.
title: Cristom 1998 Marjorie Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Very rich and opulent, in the Heidi Barrett style, this Cabernet is sweetly jammy but somewhat direct in blackberries, cherries and raspberries. The finish is extraordinarily long and spicy, an indication that it's a wine for the cellar. Firm tannins and fine acidity confirm its ageability. Hold this flashy, decadent wine until 2016 and then try it again.
title: Au Sommet 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: Cocoa, coffee, spice and dark fruit aromas are followed by smooth fruit flavors. The barrel influence is primary but this still brings plenty of enjoyment, with good balance and depth of flavor.
title: Mercer 2012 Spice Cabinet Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Rhubarb, turned earth and a touch of juniper show on the nose of this wine, made by the Terravant facility in Buellton. It's decently juicy and relatively complex on the palate, with licorice, crushed herbs and a long-lasting acidity.
title: Blue Hawk 2012 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Made from the coolish Bennett Valley region of Sonoma County, this Pinot is marked by acidity and some sharp, herbal flavors suggesting tobacco. Yet it has enough cherries, raspberries, red currants and cola to provide richness. Drink now.
title: Matanzas Creek 2007 Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)

description: This Sauvignon Blanc tastes is off-dry in style. It's also a little one-dimensional, with Meyer-lemon and yellow apricot flavors that are fortunately brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Adler Fels 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: This unique project focuses on one single-vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon each year. Aromas of vanilla bean and other barrel spices are at the fore at present, with dark fruit lurking in the background. The plum and black-currant flavors are lush and full, showing a bit of warmth on the finish. The oak influence is primary at present but it has good stuffing.
title: Maloney 2014 Single Vineyard Dionysus Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Intensely dense and feral, this wine opens with a thicket of tart cherry and strawberry, followed by leathery black pepper and lavender. Medium in body and acidity, it works for the table, finding balance as it goes, before a rich taste of toffee finishes things off.
title: Gary Farrell 2013 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Testarossa reserves their most expensive wines to a best-barrels blend that usually bears a statewide appellation, a practice that is rare if not unique among California wineries. The '07 Niclaire is vast in currants, rhubarbs, cola and cedar, with sizable but finely meshed tannins, and the tart acidity that marks all of the winery's 2007 Pinot Noirs. It's drinkable now, but just barely, so decant. But will benefit from up to six years in the cellar.
title: Testarossa 2007 Niclaire Pinot Noir (California)

description: At more than four years of age, this Cabernet is as good as it will ever be. It's soft and gentle in black raspberry and cherry jam flavors, with a sugary sweet finish.
title: Wilson 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Pretty dark for a ros茅, and heavy and rich, too. Tastes like a raspberry Newton cookie.
title: Loken Cellars NV Reserve Lot 14 Grenache Ros茅 (California)

description: Displays intense aromas of beets, cola and black cherries. Some dried bracken scents emerge with airing, adding a woodsy complexity. Fairly rich and powerful, with enough soft tannins and a firm touch of acidity to keep everything together and ensure 5 or more years of longevity.
title: Siduri 1998 Muirfield Vineyard Pinot Noir (California)

description: This wine's aromas are bright, with honeysuckle, ripe peach, mandarin orange, slate and lime zest notes. It drinks just off dry, with abundant stone fruit flavors, mouthwatering acidity and a balance that's spot-on.
title: Poet's Leap 2016 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A very rich, ripe Cabernet, expressive in black cherry, mocha, cola, sweet herb and cedar flavors. It's a little young, so give it 3鈥? years in the bottle, but this is not a wine to age for a long time.
title: Joseph Family 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This is sourced from the Maresh vineyard, which dates back to 1970. These older vines deliver that extra dollop of texture and mouthfeel that elevates the drinking experience. Powerful and yet elegant, it brings a panoply of berries, baking spices, Asian spices, nougat, caramel and milk chocolate. It delivers all of this and more, without feeling heavy or overblown. It drank even better after being open a full 24 hours.
title: Scott Paul 2013 Audrey Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Smells and tastes over-oaked; a little too acidic and thin in flavor. The oak tannins are strongly astringent.
title: Concannon 2007 Nina's Cuvee Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

description: Cassis liqueur, blueberry notes and a smoky cured-meat element comprise the nose of this engaging, beautifully balanced offering. Dried cherry, cedar, tea and tobacco flavors predominate, and the texture is supple. The long finish displays handsome cherry and coffee notes, with plentiful but even tannins. Almost drinkable now, but best after 2002.
title: Signorello 1997 Padrone Red (Napa Valley)

description: Mistral is 80% Syrah and 20% Grenache, aged two years in 20% new French oak. A pleasing hint of funk envelops the ripe purple berry and cassis fruit. Savory herb and pepper highlights come into play, and the long, smooth finish shows clean earth and a pat of butter.
title: Jaxon 2012 Mistral Syrah-Grenache (Rogue Valley)

description: This wine would be a great value even for more money. It's bone dry, soft and extremely balanced, with cherry, black currant, plum and carob flavors that are grounded with a nice, sweet edge of fresh herbs and tobacco.
title: Napa Family Vineyards 2004 Reserve Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Spice comes up in the nose and on the palate, punching up the fruit and bringing with it a nutty barrel-inflected base. Black cherry and blue plum cover the core fruit flavors, with a lovely sweet concentration dead center in the midpalate. This young wine is finely crafted and clearly built to age. Drink 2018 through 2028.
title: Furioso 2014 La Linea Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Soft with cranberry and red currant accents, this fairly priced wine is subtle in tannin and oak, with a core of succulent black cherry and clove flavor. Approachable and round on the palate, it's a good choice for big gatherings.
title: Kicker Cane 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Deeply brooding notes of crushed violets, rose petals, black cherries, thyme and sagebrush make for a manly take on this often feminine grape. Elderberry fruit shows on the palate, as do more violets and lilacs, dried mint, sagebrush, menthol and pine-needle flavors.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: With honeyed flavors of peaches, pineapples, wildflowers and spices, this single-vineyard Viognier has fine acidic crispness that balances its slight sweetness.
title: Bask 2006 Babcock Ranch Viognier (Suisun Valley)

description: There is absolutely no better value in a California Zinfandel than this boxed wine, the equivalent of four regular bottles at $4.75 each. It's a pretty wine, dry, silky and flavorful in raspberries, mocha and pepper.
title: Bota Box 2009 Old Vine 3 L Zinfandel (California)

description: This wine still seems to be in its shell, showing considerable reduction that persists in the aromas and flavors. It drinks off dry with broad apple flavors.
title: Convergence Zone 2014 Drizzle Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)

description: Soft in texture and semi-sweet, this simple Merlot has sugary cherry and blackberry flavors.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Merlot (California)

description: This graceful wine, from a cool vintage, nicely expresses the more elegant side of Pinot Noir. There are ample fruit flavors of plum, cherry and blueberry, and a pleasantly musky note overlays the maturing fruit. It's rolling along smoothly into a fully integrated finish. Drink now through 2020.
title: Carlton Hill 2011 Estate Pinot Noir

description: This well-balanced wine has light floral, appley aromas, good acidity to drive its mouth-filling fruit flavors along, and just enough body to contribute a smooth mouthfeel. Hints of white pepper and lemon zest give it an attractive savory edge.
title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

description: This inviting Pinot is broadly ripe and fully lush in earthy, spicy layers, dark cherry and plum that plays across the palate. With a long, substantial finish, iot suits pork roasts and bacon-wrapped scallops.
title: Guarachi Family 2012 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This falls sbetween a ros茅 and an orange wine in its appearance, a pale salmon/copper shade that results from 36 hours of skin contact before pressing. Scents of hibiscus tea and rosewater put a delicate top note ahead of rich, ripe, round and spicy citrus fruit. A strong impression of cinnamon marks the finish.
title: Antiquum Farm 2014 Aurosa Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Herb, pencil lead, plum and vanilla aromas are followed by smooth, soft blue-fruit flavors. It shows a beautiful sense of balance.
title: Northstar 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This lighter, fruit-forward Syrah from Abacela showcases the spicy, peppery side of the grape. These may be younger vines, or simply less ripe than the fruit that went into the other Syrah, but it is still a very attractive wine, with sweet raspberries, black pepper and rock. A fine balance of acid and tannin provides the right structure for near-term drinking.
title: Abacela 2004 Umpqua Cuv茅e Syrah (Southern Oregon)

description: This has a mild, soft nose, with scents of broad black fruit, boiled asparagus and peppered meat. The palate is full bodied, with ripe tannins. A note of sour black-raspberry candy marks the finish.
title: Montelle 2010 Chambourcin (Missouri)

description: Barrel-fermented and aged sur lie for 10 months, this elegant Chardonnay offers immaculate scents and flavors of lemon rind and pith, a dusting of spice, and a generous slice of ripe apple. It's full and luscious in the mouth, with appealing texture, barrel toast and just a pat of butter in the finish.
title: Novelty Hill 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A bit weak on the nose, this bottling gives off scents of charred toast and cold steel. The palate offers flavors of sour orange rind and tart apple flesh.
title: Esser 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This was done half in stainless and half in oak, and the blend is near perfect. Spicy and full-bodied, the peppery fruit is nicely set against a gentle backdrop of barrel toast. Cantaloupe, apple and papaya flavors are in abundance, with a finish of toasted coconut.
title: Obelisco Estate 2011 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This 100% varietal comes from StoneTree and Red Heaven vineyards. Fruit-forward, it suggests blueberry pie with barrel notes of pencil lead and vanilla. It's full bodied and supple in feel with abundant blue-fruit flavors and smoked-meat accents on the warm, lingering finish.
title: Dusted Valley 2012 Rachis Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a benchmark rendition of Pinot Gris. The flavors are fruit driven, with lime, apple and pear notes combining on the smooth, relatively soft midpalate. This is a consistent wine, even with its production level of 100,000 cases.
title: King Estate 2011 Signature Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: Shows the estate vineyard's signature in the moderate alcohol, sleek, streamlined mouthfeel, bright acidity and intensity of flavor. It's laser-like in lime, mango, honey and vanilla, with minerally overtones that taste of the earth. Drink now, as it is very fine and delicious.
title: Failla 2011 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Unabashedly buttery and oaky in aroma and flavor, this first-class, full-bodied wine has a mouth-filling, creamy texture that lingers long into the finish. It starts with buttered toast and almond aromas and opens into a rich pear-and-hazelnut palate, its flavors unfolding in nuanced layers.
title: Shannon Ridge 2015 Red Hills Ranch Reserve Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: This is a lush, soft and frankly delicious Pinot Noir that delivers far more quality than most Pinots under $20. It's dry and silky, with flavors of raspberries, cherries, cola, vanilla and spices, and a sweet vanilla veneer of oak.
title: Elizabeth Rose 2008 Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: Fragrant yellow and purple flowers on the nose and palate of this medium-sweet Riesling add a subtle perfume to all of the ripe, luscious white-peach and nectarine flavors. Hints of wet stone and lime-like acidity lend a crisp, tonic tone to the midpalate, extending onto the long, lingering finish.
title: Glenora 2011 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: More orange or lightly blush than straw-hued, this is a fine single-vineyard wine. It's bone-dry, complex and sophisticated, with persistent pear and peach skin flavors, offering more detail and less obvious fruit than most Oregon Pinot Gris.
title: Duck Pond 2016 Hylo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: An absolutely lovely wine, made in the modern, soft style, but with great structural integrity. The delicious flavors come in waves of currants, wild berries, peppery spices, chocolate-covered mint, licorice and cedary oak influences. Fully drinkable now due to the finely ground, velvety tannins.
title: Petroni 2006 Rosso di Sonoma Estate Red (Sonoma Valley)

description: Impressively delicate but also generous in aromas, this bottling shows lemon curd, caramelized apple and a touch of baby powder on the nose. There's a sharp line of salty acidity on the palate, with flavors of candied apple and Meyer lemon.
title: Wrights Station 2013 Backwards Block Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: If a Cabernet can be smooth and creamy, this one is. It offers plenty of fruit flavor, firm tannins that coat the mouth in a good way, plus a plush texture that keeps it from being even a bit harsh. With medium body, a great mouthfeel and lingering finish, there's much to like.
title: Noble Vines 2012 337 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Summit View, Klipsun and Doval vineyards. Aromas of wood spice, purple fruit, vanilla and exotic spice are followed by tart cranberry and cherry flavors, with the midpalate dipping in concentration. The tannins bring quite a bit of grip.
title: Browne Family Vineyards 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Simple and sharp in acidity, this Pinot has a jammy raspberry flavor. It tastes sugary-sweet all through the finish. It was tasted twice.
title: Thomas Scott 2010 Grand Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A nice glass of Cab for $13. It's bone dry, with a scour of sandpapery tannins, and hints of cherries, blackberries, plums, cola and cedar. Shows real class for a statewide-appellated Cab at this price.
title: Tin Roof 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This is a big, meaty wine that wears its youthfulness on its sleeve, showing a touch of reduction and assertive oak. Beneath its wall of ripeness, black licorice, cherry and pomegranate characteristics are buoyed by a depth of thick tannin.
title: MacRostie 2014 Manzana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: This is as good as the best from California鈥攖extural, creamy, a delicious mix of lemon custard, meringue, caramel, papaya and toasted coconut. At one quarter the price of comparable bottles, this young wine just seduces from the instant it hits the tongue.
title: Efeste 2009 Lola Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The darkest and richest of this winery's trio of Pinots, a big-boned wine with surface flavors ranging from blackberries and cherries to cola, leather and tobacco. There's a meatiness to the texture that makes it a perfect match for food. Feels smooth and silky in the mouth, but lacks the depth to merit a higher score.
title: Savannah-Chanelle 2000 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Aromas of toasted bread and vanilla echo in the rich, buttery flavors of this full-bodied and lavishly textured white Rh么ne-style blend. The oaky spices make it serious and complex while mild pear and almond flavors take a second seat.
title: Rock Wall 2015 Mama's Reserve White (California)

description: A simple and candied Pinot Noir, this has tasty raspberry and cherry jam flavors, plus rich, oak-derived notes of buttered toast.
title: Alderbrook 2010 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an experiment in a bottle, a 100% whole-cluster, carbonic maceration Pinot that intrigues and delights. Light and clear, it opens with wildly crazy aromas of earthy herb and dirty strawberry, remaining pillowy on the palate. The finish is edgy in pine and spice.
title: Inman Family 2013 Whole Buncha Love OGV Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Moderately full and roundly fruity, with an undertone of mineral or concrete. This is a nicely managed blend, with the balance and grip to age for another five years.
title: RouteStock 2010 99W Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This winery northeast of San Diego sources from up north and experiments heavily with stem inclusion on this bottling, which shows cherry blossoms, crushed cranberries and an earthy line of anise through the nose. Plush purple fruit flavors of olallieberry and boysenberry power the medium-bodied palate, with sage and peppercorn spice throughout.
title: Orfila 2013 Stem Head Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is three-fifths Cabernet Sauvignon, the rest split between Cabernet Franc and Merlot. It's supple and forward, with pretty, plummy fruit and pleasing touches of cinnamon and spice.
title: :Nota Bene 2009 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

description: Mourv猫dre (81%) makes up the majority of this blend with Grenache (12%) and Syrah filling it out. It leans into savory notes, with aromas of sage, dried herbs, white pepper and mineral. The flavors are plush and palate-coating, bringing a slightly tacky feel that softens over time. It will be best after 2019.
title: Efeste 2012 Emmy Red (Wahluke Slope)

description: From a small family-run operation that is 100% estate, this Cab is thick in blueberry and blackberry, almost syrupy rich. With a big juicy backbone, it offers a full-figured body and leathery texture, ending explosively with notes of black licorice and toffee. Cellar through 2020.
title: Summit Lake 2010 Emily Kestrel Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: This is a very powerful Chardonnay, brimming in guava, golden mango, white peach, pear and Key lime pie flavors, to which smoky oak adds even richer layers of butterscotch and caramel. A crisp edge of peppery acidity provides a clean, zesty balance to this enormous wine.
title: Stonestreet 2006 Broken Road Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This medium-bodied wine is fresh and fruity, but also polished and sophisticated. It smells like raspberries and black plums, then adds chocolate and blackberry in the flavors. Rich and flavorful it also has welcome firm tannins and fruit acidity to keep it lively. Grenache is the leading grape ingredient.
title: Fenestra 2010 Estate Infrared Red (Livermore Valley)

description: This Cabernet Franc has a slightly watery, sweet fruit element that lacks the cheerful vibrancy and pluckiness of the variety. On the nose, it offers soft red fruit and some spice, but the flavors feel weak. Not a bad wine overall, but needs some muscle.
title: Sheldrake Point 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: Luscious tropical fruit and jasmine notes are framed by hints of fresh green herb and grass. A spray of lemony acidity and smoky white-tea notes add delicate flair to the finish.
title: Rooster Hill 2010 Medium Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This is sweet and simple, but its slight burn on the finish makes it harder to swallow.
title: flipflop NV Headshrinker Sweet Red Blend Red (California)

description: The aromas bring generous notes of botrytis, chamomile, flowers, peach, ale and green apple. It drinks off dry, with well-balanced stone fruit and floral flavors that linger.
title: Dunham 2014 Lewis Estate Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon is brooding in dried sage, cedar and pencil shavings, the fruit black and ripe. Oaky and sanguine, it has a girth to it. Sprinkles of cinnamon and clove peak on the finish.
title: Buehler 2012 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Marked by immediately likeable fruit in the form of raspberries and cherries, this pleasant Pinot has a rich coating of sweet, smoky oak. It's the most accessible of Williams Selyem's new releases.
title: Williams Selyem 2009 Eastside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a Porty overripeness all through this wine, like concentrated raisins and prunes. Although it's basically dry, it has a raisiny sweetness, especially toward the finish.
title: Drew 2010 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: This young wine balances ripe tangy fruit flavors of apple and peach against barrel flavors from aging in roughly one-quarter new French oak. The good components are in place, but a bit more bottle age should help to pull them together.
title: Fairsing 2015 Chardonnay

description: Held back for four years before release, this Zin has achieved a creamy softness. The flavors offer a blast of peppery, briary wild red, black and blue berries and currants, with vibrant hints of bacon, cola and sandalwood. Great value in a Zinfandel this likeable.
title: Kunde 2006 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

description: Seductively tart in lemon pith, cranberry and pomegranate, this refreshing, light-bodied quaff is infinitely enjoyable, both on its own or at the table. It continues to expand on the palate into an increasing array of fresh flavors, finishing in cherry and orange.
title: Ousterhout 2014 800 Vines Jenna's Vineyard Ros茅 of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A leesy, textural, racy and refreshing Riesling, this is loaded with lime, grapefruit and melon flavors. There is a streak of gin-like botanicals as well, and a rich, resonant finish.
title: Gamache 2010 Estate Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A high-acid, weighty and complex white, this vintage is even better than the last, gorgeous in a golden tannish color. Tropical guava and white flowers weave seamlessly through a web of minerality and freshness, without compromising body and texture. This is a delicious wine.
title: Wayfarer 2013 Wayfarer Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: A soft, creamy texture houses buttery flavors of blackberry jam and mocha in this Cab, which has a drop of Merlot. It's flashy and opulent, in the modern Napa style, with relatively high alcohol that gives a bite of heat. Drink it over the next six years.
title: Robinson Family Vineyards 2010 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Dark and inky, this wine is made from a small vineyard on the western slopes of its appellation, planted entirely to the variety. Juicy blackberry and black plum play off of milk chocolate and vanilla, the tannins still teeth-staining, though the oak remains well-integrated and the texture soft.
title: Shippey 2012 Flaming J Vineyard Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A blend of fruit from three different sites, united by their green farming practices, this is clean, fruity and forward. A mouth-pleasing Pinot with generously juicy and pretty cherry flavors.
title: Panther Creek 2008 Verde Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Wild red berries, crushed pepper, lilacs and a frame of asphalt show on the exuberant nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with meat, smoke, cedar, charcoal and easy boysenberry flavors, the perfect pairing for a hamburger. It is a tad light in body, especially since it hasaged for so many years.
title: DeTierra Vineyards 2010 Russell Estate Merlot (Monterey)

description: There's lots of mouthwatering acidity in this bone-dry Pinot Noir, with an ample supply of ripe fruit in the form of raspberries and cherries. There's also something wonderfully earthy, like roasted mushrooms splashed with balsamic and tamari sauce. The cool 2010 vintage was kind to Bacigalupi Vineyard, which can produce overripe wines in hot years.
title: Von Holt 2010 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: An estate-grown vineyard-designate, this impressive offering is smooth in cherry, berry and clove, with wisps of black pepper dancing around its edges. The finish is long and spicy. It's complex yet fun, and will do well at the table though it's also easy enough to enjoy on its own.
title: MacPhail 2014 Mardikian Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Elegant and lush aromas of black plum and boysenberry mesh with violets and lavender on the nose of this wine. Earthy tones of mace, cinnamon and crushed gravel enhance the bouquet, while wild berries pop on the palate. Flavors of bay leaf, coffee bean and more lavender ride atop the soft and polished tannins.
title: Beckon 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Thea's Selection book-ends the single-vineyard wines and is the winery's lower-priced, multi-vineyard blend. As with the Jerome, the flavors are more complex and woven than in the single-vineyard bottlings; with cherry and berry fruit, fresh herb and streaks of bitter chocolate. It's a complete, supple wine, with no holes, moderately ripe fruit, and just a hint of heat in the finish.
title: Lemelson 2005 Thea's Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A big, thick, massive Cabernet, impressive for sheer volume. Yet it's very tannic and dry. Deep down inside is an intense core of concentrated blackberry essence, coated in smoky new oak. This feels dramatic and important, but nowhere near ready. Give it eight years in the cellar.
title: Stonestreet 2009 Christopher's Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Overoaked and tired, a simple, sweet Chardonnay with buttered popcorn and pineapple jam flavors.
title: Spell Wine 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A juicy Touriga with nice structure and acidity, it bursts with notes of strawberry, cherry and vanilla spice, especially on the finish. A perfect pizza wine.
title: Chatom Vineyards 2009 Touriga Nacional (Calaveras County)

description: Another fine Syrah from Otis Kenyon Winemaker Dave Stephenson, this full-flavored wine shows clear varietal character. Tasty fruit flavors of blueberry and boysenberry are highlighted with baking spices, moving into a smooth finish with a milk chocolate kick.
title: Otis Kenyon 2008 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Co-fermented with 5% Viognier, this wine's appealing fresh flower, orange peel, ham hock and black olive tapenade aromas jump out of the glass. The palate is light, tart and sleek, not delivering on all that the aromas suggest but still providing plenty of intrigue.
title: Eternal 2015 Eternal Restraint Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Crisp and refreshing, this blend of 85% Chenin Blanc and 15% Viognier is high in acidity with a creamy midpalate. Guava is most notable flavor, followed by kiwi and honey. Oysters would be a good call.
title: Vinum 2012 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

description: This vineyard has been source to wildly variable Pinot Noirs, but Garnet, has succeeded in wresting a fine Pinot Noir. It shows the dry silkiness and acidity you want from a coastal Pinot, with elaborate, oak-influenced cherry, cola and pomegranate flavors that finish dry and spicy. Enjoy it over the next five years.
title: Garnet 2010 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The vintage was terribly difficult, with cold and rain everywhere, leading to widespread mold, especially along the coast. This Pinot seems to suffer from that problem despite some good raspberry and cherry fruit flavors.
title: Roth 2010 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Rounded plum and berry aromas grow more complex thanks to hints of sarsparilla bark, rose buds, cinnamon stick and nutmeg on the nose of this cool-climate bottling. The palate is quite peppery, with dried red flowers, red plums, peppercorns, strawberries and a texturally earthy core of fine-grained tannins.
title: Stephen Ross 2013 Jespersen Ranch Grenache (Edna Valley)

description: This 100% varietal wine offers a simplicity of blueberry, black licorice and chocolate wrapped in integrated tannin and oak. Full bodied and ripe, it softens in the glass to a rounded finish.
title: William Harrison 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Rutherford)

description: Raw, common and unripe, with vegetal and bizarrely sweet blackberry candy notes. A tough but serviceable blend of seven popular varieties.
title: Seven Daughters NV Winemaker's Blend Red (California)

description: This wine is massively ripe, with black currant, dark chocolate and anise flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon brings a black currant note and tannic power, Cabernet Franc adds a cherried richness, and Merlot lends a soft, feminine touch. The result is noble, but big, thick tannins call for time in the cellar. Consider opening from 2017, although it will go for a decade or two longer than that.
title: Cornerstone 2010 The Cornerstone Red (Napa Valley)

description: This isn't a long-term ager, but do give it about a year in the bottle to let all of its parts meld together. Right now, it's tight and oaky. It features intense, bright pineapple, green apple and orange flavors, with sweet barrel influences and a tenuous streak of acidity.
title: Rochioli 2011 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The light aromas suggest notes of star fruit and citrus. The palate is flavorful, with racy acids keeping the fruit in focus.
title: Kerloo 2015 Blue Mountain Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: A vital, focused Cabernet, this shows the sheer classiness of Oakville in its concentrated blackberry and black currant fruit. It's seemingly sweet and dry at the same time, and the tannins, which are extraordinarily thick, are fine and pure. Irresistably delicious now, this changes in the glass by the second. It suggests it wants some time in the cellar, so drink now鈥?021.
title: Pi帽a 2009 Ames Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: This fragrant, concentrated wine offers vivid mint, cherry and clove aromas followed by rhubarb, red cherry and rosemary flavors that are focused and memorable. The balance is spot-on, with good acidity and velvety tannins that brace the richness of the fruit components. Best after 2022.
title: Freeman 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Easy-drinking and dry, it starts with pleasant strawberry and raspberry aromas that lead to moderately rich fruit flavors accented with white pepper. It doesn't feel as full-bodied as one might expect from Amador, and has an almost soft, silky finish.
title: Sobon Estate 2011 Rezerve Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: All varietal, this wine offers aromas of cocoa, fresh herbs, cassis, cranberry and licorice. The flavors are sweet and high octane, with an open finish.
title: SuLei 2012 Les Collines Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Wood smoke and charcoal aromas lead to flavors like cola, steak sauce and cherries in this dramatic, Rh么ne-style wine blended from notoriously meaty Mourv猫dre plus Grenache and Syrah. A touch of sweetness and light tannins complete the picture of this wine made by a longtime Rh么ne variety specialist.
title: Cline 2015 Cashmere Exquisite Red (California)

description: Apparently this is the current release. The winery aims at a Right Bank, Bordeaux-style profile. At this advanced age the wine is showing some bricking at the edges, with mature drying fruit and a big dose of barrel. Smoky, oaky and toasty, it's a wine to drink up, perhaps with a big steak dinner.
title: Cricket Hill 2009 Merlot (Applegate Valley)

description: Clean and proper, if a bit soft and simple. Shows modest cherry-berry flavors with a touch of oak.
title: The Crusher 2008 Wilson Vineyard Merlot (Clarksburg)

description: Muscular, mildly sweaty aromatics make this a little tough to get into, but the flavors are really elevated and complex. There's layered citrus, slate, licorice and spice all working together. The texture is nice, with spiciness coming on late. A bit of sweetness properly offsets the spicy, peppery quality to the finish.
title: Duckhorn 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This has enormously high alcohol, but the fruit is curiously thin, with some unripeness. The amount of new oak doesn't seem to help.
title: Hug 2010 Starr Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This wine is still so young and immature with fresh, jammy, berry flavors, spice and juicy acidity. Hold the wine for a year or three to allow it to settle and mature.
title: Windsor Oaks 2011 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Floral and spicy aromas like lychee and rose petal give an exotic twist to this unusual light-bodied wine made from Sauvignon Blanc. It tastes quite dry, with a fine-beaded texture as well as ample acidity to buoy the wine's fruity and floral characteristics.
designation: Cuv茅e Agincourt Blanc de Blanc Brut
title: Bodkin NV Cuv茅e Agincourt Blanc de Blanc Brut Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: Shows the richness of fruit, as well as oak, that has lately characterized this Monterey-grown Chardonnay, with very ripe pineapple and cr猫me br没l茅e flavors. Feels somewhat obvious, lacking the subtle appeal of the 2007. Drink now.
title: McIntyre Vineyards 2008 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A seamless commingling of cardamom and allspice around bursts of black cherry, this is a soft, dark and brooding wine, with an earthy soul and a spicy finish. Still young, it should take on further nuance over time, but is good to go right now.
title: Whetstone 2013 Jon Boat Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Drink this polished Chardonnay now with shellfish or chicken stew. It's crisp and minerally, with a hit of acidity backing up the citrus fruit, honey and vanilla oak flavors.
title: Simi 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A malty, full bouquet with good complexity announces this well-constructed wine. Pleasant citrus and hay flavors, medium weight and a good steady bead add to the package. A good clean finish with a grapefruit tang wraps it up.
title: Pacific Echo 1995 Private Reserve Brut  (Anderson Valley)

description: This is the second label of Young Inglewood, a blend of 93% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot that spent 20 months in all-French oak, one quarter of it new. Meant to be approachable young, it is, while retaining a concentration of licorice, black currant and blackberry wrapped in dark chocolate. Firm tannins give it structure.
title: VENN 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
